properties.name: 3 Goats Vineyard + Winery
properties.description: 3 Goats Vineyard is a micro-boutique winery and tasting room owned by high school sweethearts Chris and Candice Plewik. While their estate vineyard grows Pinot Noir in Gaston, they craft a diverse selection of reds, whites, and sparkling wines from grapes sourced throughout Oregon and Washington. The owners are often present at their Downtown Forest Grove tasting room, offering a personal wine tasting experience.

properties.name: Abundancia Vineyards
properties.description: This small family-run estate practices meticulous dry farming and hand-harvested viticulture across Jory and Willakenzie soils, producing Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Spanish varietals including Tempranillo. Everything is grown, aged, and bottled on-site with a philosophy rooted in allowing the vineyard to speak through the wine.

properties.name: Adelsheim Vineyard
properties.description: Founded in 1971, this pioneering estate farms multiple LIVE-certified vineyards, including historic Quarter Mile Lane and the expansive Ribbon Springs site, and is a Certified B Corporation. The vineyard-side tasting room pours Pinot Noir and Chardonnay with focused single-vineyard bottlings and seasonal garden seating.

properties.name: Aegrina Vineyard
properties.description: Perched on a southwest slope in the McMinnville foothills, Aegrina Vineyard is a distinct, LIVE-certified estate known for its slow-ripening fruit and complex, structured wines. The vineyard's unique climate and thin volcanic soils yield Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays with a notable backbone and deep, savory character.

properties.name: Aeolus Vineyards
properties.address: 3935 Oak Knoll Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: This small 5-acre vineyard in the Eola-Amity Hills uses organic farming techniques while pursuing certification and notably planted some of the region's first Tempranillo vines alongside Pinot Noir. Named after the Greek god of wind, its sustainably grown fruit supplies acclaimed producers like Stangeland and Landmass, reflecting its volcanic-slope terroir shaped by coastal breezes.

properties.name: Airlie Winery
properties.description: Airlie Winery, a scenic estate in the forests west of Monmouth and established in 1986, is celebrated for its sustainably crafted Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and unique white blends like its 'Seven' wine. This dog-friendly winery offers a relaxed tasting experience amid scenic vineyard and pond views from its patio, as well as certified sustainable and Salmon Safe.

properties.name: Alexana Winery
properties.address: 12001 NE Worden Hill Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: Alexana Winery is known for its estate-grown Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its 80-acre Revana Vineyard, with a focus on sustainable practices and expressing the terroir of its geologically diverse estate. The winery offers an elevated tasting experience with panoramic views of the Dundee Hills from its modern facility and holds both LEED Gold and LIVE sustainable winegrowing certifications.

properties.name: Alexeli Vineyard + Winery
properties.description: This family-run, LIVE-certified winery specializes in sustainably farmed European varietals like Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Riesling from vines planted in the early 1980s, alongside a small Syrah plot. Known for its rustic tasting room, scenic Cascade foothills setting, and event-friendly grounds, it combines heritage viticulture with warm hospitality in a boutique-scale operation.

properties.name: Alit Wines / Breakside Brewery
properties.description: Alit Wines, under Breakside Brewery ownership, produces Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its own organically farmed estate vineyards and sources fruit from specific sites within the Dundee Hills and Eola-Amity Hills AVAs. The winemaking focuses on minimalist techniques, including native yeast fermentation and dry farming, to express the character of these vineyard sites.

properties.name: Alloro Vineyard
properties.description: Alloro Vineyard is a Tuscan-inspired estate on the Laurel Ridge in the Chehalem Mountains, known for its estate-grown Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Riesling produced through sustainable practices. The winery offers a sophisticated tasting experience with expansive territorial views from its Mediterranean-style tasting room .

properties.name: Alpine Vineyards
properties.description: Alpine Vineyards crafts cool-climate Pinot Noir expressive of the Willamette Valley's volcanic soils and maritime-continental terroir, yielding wines with signature notes of red berries, florals, and earthy complexity. Though specific estate details are limited in the sources, its bottlings exemplify Oregon's signature style—elegant, nuanced, and Burgundian in inspiration, earning recognition among enthusiasts for balance and typicity.

properties.name: Alumbra Cellars, Inc.
properties.address: 12655 SE String Town Rd, Dayton, OR 97114
properties.description: Alumbra Cellars is a Latina-owned family vineyard known for its sustainable farming and wines that celebrate Latino heritage and family roots. The winery produces small-batch, estate-grown wines such as Pinot Noir and Grenache, with a tasting room in McMinnville and the estate vineyard located in the Dundee Hills near Dayton.

properties.name: Amalie Robert Estate
properties.description: Founded by a couple transitioning from corporate careers, this family-owned winery sustainably farms 35 acres and operates a gravity-flow facility, specializing in terroir-driven Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and unique Gewürztraminer. It is acclaimed for elegant, whole-cluster-fermented wines and critically praised Pinot Noirs like the iPinot series and limited single-clone bottlings.

properties.name: Amaterra Winery
properties.address: 8150 SW Swede Hl Dr, Portland, OR 97225
properties.description: Amaterra features a 12-acre estate vineyard and patent-pending gravity-flow winery minutes from downtown Portland, producing terroir-driven Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. The property offers sweeping valley views and an acclaimed restaurant that was named Portland's #1 in 2025.

properties.name: Ambar Estate
properties.address: 12550 NE Worden Hill Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: Ambar Estate is the first Regenerative Organic Certified vineyard in the region, known for its estate-grown Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. The winery provides a tranquil tasting experience with food pairings, set within its beautiful vineyards.

properties.name: Anacréon Winery
properties.description: Named after the ancient Greek poet who wrote of love and wine, this family-owned boutique produces fewer than 1,000 cases annually from their organically certified, dry-farmed Belle Colline vineyard. Intimate tastings at the owners' home offer personal experiences with chef-prepared food pairings and views of the 25-acre estate.

properties.name: Andante Vineyard
properties.description: Family-owned and embracing a 'deliberately moderate tempo' this intimate, LIVE/Salmon Safe–certified estate in the Van Duzer Corridor crafts elegant, low-intervention wines like acclaimed Sauvignon Blanc and rare Aligoté from its 15-acre vineyard . Visitors savor panoramic views from a striking corten steel tasting room with covered patios, EV charging, and artisan food pairings amid a tranquil, music-infused ambiance.

properties.name: Anderson Family Vineyard
properties.description: Anderson Family Vineyard is a family-owned estate known for its distinctive vineyard, which was chiseled into an ancient landslide of fractured basalt on a steep Dundee Hills slope. This challenging, organically farmed site yields intense, terroir-driven Pinot Noir and Chardonnay for their small-batch, estate-grown bottlings.

properties.name: Andrew Rich Wines
properties.description: Andrew Rich Wines crafts a distinctive portfolio of Pinot Noir and Rhône-style varietals, earning recognition as a pioneer for its Northwest-inspired Syrah, Roussanne, and Mourvèdre. The winery is also known for its sought-after Gewürztraminer dessert wine and operates on a small scale, with much of its production sold directly from the winery.

properties.name: Ankeny Vineyard
properties.description: Ankeny Vineyard, established in 1980 in Salem’s hills, crafts estate-grown Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and award-winning Maréchal Foch from volcanic Nekia soil while overlooking the Ankeny National Wildlife Refuge. Known for its rustic ambiance, wood-fired pizzas, live music weekends, and scenic patio, this dog-friendly destination offers relaxed tastings amid vineyard and migratory bird views.

properties.name: Antica Terra Vineyard
properties.description: This vineyard crafts terroir-driven Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its fossil-strewn, sandstone vineyard, farmed biodynamically to express the site's extreme conditions through small, thick-skinned berries and intense flavors. Renowned for immersive tastings with James Beard-recognized cuisine and rare vintages, this winery blends artistic innovation (like multi-vintage compositions) with luxury experiences in its candlelit Barrel Hall or at the dramatic 'Table in the Trees'.

properties.name: Antiquum Farm Tasting Room
properties.description: Antiquum Farm Tasting Room offers exclusive, reservation-only experiences in a rustic Farm Cottage nestled within its Junction City vineyards, featuring intimate private tastings of acclaimed Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris paired with charcuterie. This family-owned pioneer of 'grazing-based viticulture' integrates sheep, pigs, and poultry into its self-sustaining ecosystem, creating wines that express the terroir through innovative, chemical-free farming.

properties.name: Appassionata Estate
properties.description: Appassionata Estate is Ernst Loosen’s estate, with a 20-acre vineyard planted mostly to Pinot Noir, plus Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc. Known for patient methods, barrel fermentations and extended cellaring, with some wines held up to 10 years, it releases ageworthy Pinot Noir, barrel-fermented Chardonnay, acacia-aged Sauvignon Blanc, and dry Riesling.

properties.name: Aramenta Cellars
properties.address: 17979 NE Lewis Rogers Ln, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: This family-owned, small-batch producer on 27 acres specializes in handcrafted Pinot Noir using traditional methods with no fruit manipulation. Owner-winemakers Ed and Darlene create a rustic, unpretentious experience where visitors interact directly with the farmers and taste wines barely aged in barrel.

properties.name: Arborbrook Vineyards
properties.description: Arborbrook centers on a 15-acre estate of Pinot Noir planted in 2001, rooted in marine-sedimentary soils, with clone bottlings alongside Chardonnay and rosé. A renovated 1910 barn houses the tasting room; as part of Cooper Mountain, the wines draw on organic, biodynamic farming and show supple red-fruited elegance.

properties.name: Archery Summit
properties.address: 18599 NE Archery Summit Rd, Dayton, OR 97114
properties.description: Archery Summit is a pioneering Dundee Hills estate known for its acclaimed, terroir-driven Pinot Noir sourced from five distinct estate vineyards. The winery offers an elegant experience featuring a hilltop tasting house with panoramic views and immersive tours of its unique gravity-flow facility and barrel caves.

properties.name: Archetype12 Wines
properties.description: Archetype12 is an artisanal winery and cidery that organizes wines into twelve archetypal personality types, offering a unique perspective on varietal expression. Their companion project, Terroir Incognito, crafts ciders from crowd-sourced fruit, emphasizing sustainability and community collaboration with small-batch, experimental releases.

properties.name: Ardiri Winery and Vineyards
properties.description: This small boutique winery produces limited quantities of elegant Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and Pinot Blanc from estate fruit and California's Napa Valley. Voted one of Oregon's top wineries with a view, its hillside tasting room commands sweeping panoramas of vineyard and Mount Hood.

properties.name: Argyle Winery
properties.description: Argyle Winery's downtown Dundee tasting room is located in a repurposed hazelnut processing plant on its original winery site, featuring a contemporary design that incorporates historic elements like the original fermentation tanks. The winery is a pioneer of Oregon sparkling wine and produces a diverse portfolio from its estate vineyards in the Dundee Hills and Eola-Amity Hills AVAs.

properties.name: Arlyn Vineyard
properties.description: This boutique, dry-farmed estate produces Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Gamay Noir on 20 acres within a 40-acre working farm complete with livestock and gardens. Wines are crafted by Thomas Savre of Lingua Franca, bringing Burgundian expertise to organically and biodynamically farmed fruit.

properties.name: Artisanal Wine Cellars
properties.description: Artisanal Wine Cellars is a family-operated tasting room known for its small-lot, handcrafted wines that express the distinct character of the vineyards it sources from across various Willamette Valley AVAs. The winery was named one of Wine Spectator's 'Eight New Names to Know' for its portfolio that allows the unique qualities of each vineyard site to shine through.

properties.name: Artist Block Tasting Room
properties.description: Artist Block Tasting Room offers a contemporary experience that blends a passion for wine with a curated art gallery atmosphere. The wines are crafted for a new generation, featuring creative selections like Sparkling Gamay and skin-contact Pinot Gris, all sourced from organically farmed vineyards.

properties.name: A to Z Wineworks
properties.description: Founded in 2002 by four Oregon industry veterans, this winery sources fruit from across the valley and emphasizes sustainable business practices, including its B Corp certification. Their wines, most notably a pinot noir once named to Wine Spectator’s Top 100, combine broad appeal with a strong environmental and social commitment.

properties.name: August Cellars
properties.description: This multi-winery facility houses eight small producers under one roof, utilizing a gravity-flow winemaking system on a family farm in operation since 1942. Known for affordable wines including Pinot Noir and the American hybrid Marechal Foch, the shared space offers diverse tasting options from multiple winemakers.

properties.name: Aurora Vineyards
properties.description: Family-owned since 2002, this winery features an on-site restaurant with chef-prepared cuisine, a tasting room with live music, and scenic grounds including a waterfall patio. Known for Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, it also hosts weddings and events in its amphitheater and modern event center.

properties.name: Authentique Wine Cellars
properties.description: Authentique Wine Cellars crafts single-vineyard Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and skin-contact Pinot Gris from its organically and biodynamically certified Keeler Estate Vineyard in the Eola-Amity Hills. Known for spontaneous fermentations in diverse vessels (oak, concrete, amphorae) and minimal intervention, its critically acclaimed wines (90+ scores) are available through appointment-only tastings.

properties.name: Avidity Wines
properties.description: Avidity Wines is a family-owned vineyard and tasting room situated on Parrett Mountain, known for its range of wines from Willamette Valley Pinot Noir and Chardonnay to Columbia Valley Bordeaux-style reds. The estate offers a relaxed setting for enjoying exceptional wines with scenic views.

properties.name: Ayoub Wines
properties.description: Ayoub Wines is a small, family-run winery known for its limited-production Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its estate vineyard in the Dundee Hills, with total annual production remaining under 2,000 cases. Founded by Mo Ayoub, the winery focuses on wines of balance and complexity, employing small-lot fermentations and organic farming methods for its estate fruit.

properties.name: Ayres Vineyard
properties.address: 17971 NE Lewis Rogers Ln, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: This boutique winery operates an underground production facility on 18 acres of LIVE-certified Pinot Noir, run entirely by owner-winemaker Brad McLeroy. His approach focusses on sustainable practices and terroir expression, crafting wines directly from the vineyard's distinctive Willakenzie soils through appointment-only tastings.

properties.name: Bacus Vineyards
properties.description: Family-run estate with organically farmed vines surrounding the tasting room, pouring Pinot Noir and Chardonnay alongside limited Riesling, Gamay, rosé, and sparkling. Guests find art and sensory tastings with vineyard views; recent releases show red-berry brightness, tea-like tannins, and spice in Pinot, and lively, stone-tinged Chardonnay.

properties.name: Bailey Family Wines
properties.address: 10660 SW Youngberg Hill Rd, McMinnville, OR 97128
properties.description: Bailey Family Wines is the reserve label from the proprietors of Youngberg Hill, crafting exquisite Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from their biodynamically farmed estate vineyards, that also serves as a bed and breakfast. These wines are known for their balance and complexity, really showing a profound commitment to terroir and minimalist winemaking .

properties.name: Balanza Vineyard
properties.description: Balanza Vineyard is a family-owned estate in the Dundee Hills, farming Pinot Noir grapes in volcanic Jory soil to produce small-lot wines including Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and a Porch Swing Rosé. The property also features a guest house and boutique bed and breakfast, offering visitors immersive stays with panoramic valley views from the vineyard.

properties.name: Balsall Creek
properties.description: Balsall Creek is an estate vineyard and winery on 35 acres, farming sustainably with LIVE, Salmon-Safe, and Bee Friendly certifications and powered by onsite solar. The tasting room overlooks the vines, pouring Pinot Noir and Chardonnay alongside limited Gamay, Aligoté, Sauvignon Blanc, and occasional sparkling and rosé.

properties.name: Barking Frog Winery
properties.description: Barking Frog Winery is a family-owned producer focused on small lots of ultra-premium wines. While their tasting room is in a downtown setting, they source their Pinot Noir from Willamette Valley vineyards and their other red varieties, such as Syrah and Barbera, from Washington state. The wines are known for their concentration and complexity, reflecting a philosophy of selecting grapes from sustainably farmed vineyards.

properties.name: Barnello Winery
properties.description: Micro-boutique estate crafting under 140 cases annually of estate-grown Pinot Noir and Chardonnay alongside unique small-lot wines like Pinot Noir Blanc and Sangiovese, all poured by owner/winemaker Ed Wagner during reservation-only experiences. Renowned for its intimate converted-horse-barn tasting room, personalized vineyard tours with grape sampling, and tailored events in a scenic tree-lined setting with picnic amenities.

properties.name: Beaux Frères
properties.address: 15155 NE North Valley Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: Co-founded in 1986 by Michael Etzel and wine critic Robert Parker Jr., this influential estate has earned multiple Wine Spectator Top 100 placements for its Pinot Noir. The rustic tasting room in a converted barn reflects the winery's authentic, down-to-earth approach to biodynamic farming.

properties.name: Beckham Estate
properties.description: Beckham Estate is a family-owned vineyard and winery known for producing wines fermented and aged in handcrafted terra cotta amphorae made on-site by winemaker and ceramics artist Andrew Beckham. The estate focuses on native yeast fermentations and offers tastings of its organically farmed, single-vineyard wines by appointment.

properties.name: Bellingar Estates
properties.address: 24055 NE North Valley Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: A family-owned vineyard and winery at the base of the Chehalem Mountains, Bellingar Estates produces a warm and approachable lineup of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Syrah and red blends. Alongside vineyard views they welcome guests in a cozy tasting room filled with cut-flower gardens, handmade crafts and a relaxed, down-to-earth atmosphere.

properties.name: BelliVadum Vineyards
properties.description: This newer family-owned producer dedicated to Pinot Noir spans two AVAs across a former filbert orchard on Dopp Road. Each vineyard block is named after the owners' three children, creating a generational legacy through bold, quality-focused wines.

properties.name: Bells Up Winery
properties.description: A micro-boutique estate operated by Dave Specter and Sara Specter, this winery produces about 600 small-lot cases annually from its Chehalem Mountains hillside vineyard and selected micro-sites, including a rare planting of Seyval Blanc. Known for intimate, appointment only, private tastings led by the winemaker, their wines span Pinot Noir, Rosé, Pinot Blanc, Syrah and more, each referencing a classical music theme.

properties.name: Benedetto Vineyards
properties.description: Family-owned by two couples with construction roots, this award-winning winery is celebrated for pioneering Gamay Noir plantings and clonal diversity Pinot Noirs (5 distinct clones), earning 2024 Best of Willamette Valley accolades including Gold for Wine Club and Live Music. Their popular Dallas tasting room offers a lively, educational experience with vineyard strolls and events in a scenic forest-edge setting.

properties.name: Bennett Vineyards & Wine Company
properties.description: Bennett Vineyards & Wine Company is a family-owned estate in Cheshire, Oregon, offering a casual countryside tasting room near Eugene with picnic-friendly lawns and regular live music events. Known for its handmade, estate-grown wines personally presented by owners Gene and Lisa Bennett, it features dog-friendly spaces, wheelchair access, and food truck partnerships for community gatherings.

properties.name: Benton-Lane Winery
properties.description: Benton-Lane Winery is a 317-acre estate in southern Willamette Valley, right on the edge of the Lower Long Tom AVA. It was founded in 1988 on the historic Sunnymount sheep ranch near Monroe. Known for pioneering high-quality, estate-grown Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, it uses sustainable, organic, and biodynamic farming practices across its 140-acre vineyard, features a scenic forest-surrounded tasting room, and has earned multiple 'Top 100 Wines of the Year' honors.

properties.name: Benza Vineyards
properties.description: Benza Vineyards is a boutique estate in the Laurelwood District, known for its Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and traditional method sparkling wines from vines grown in its unique Laurelwood and Jory soils. This family-owned winery employs high quality organic and sustainable farming practices for its estate vineyard.

properties.name: Bergström Wines Tasting Room
properties.address: By appointment, 8115 NE Worden Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: Bergström Wines is a family-run winery known for its terroir-driven Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from estate vineyards farmed without harsh chemicals. Their tasting room offers an elevated, appointment-only experience with panoramic views, reflecting a commitment to craftsmanship and a warm, intimate atmosphere.

properties.name: Bethel Heights Vineyard
properties.address: 6060 Bethel Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: A family-owned estate founded in 1977 and still operated by descendants, renowned for its sustainably farmed, old-vine Pinot Noir, particularly block-designated bottlings from own-rooted vines planted in the 1970s, and leadership in eco-certifications like LIVE and Salmon-Safe . Its volcanic-soil vineyards in the Eola-Amity Hills yield complex, terroir-driven wines celebrated for structure and ageability, with second-generation winemaking refining this legacy since 2006.

properties.name: Bieze Vineyards
properties.address: 4410 Lone Star Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: Perched high in the Eola-Amity Hills, this 25-acre site features volcanic Ritner and Nekia soils and benefits from the cooling Van Duzer Corridor winds, which extend hang time for optimal acidity and flavor development in its Pinot Noir and Chardonnay grapes. Primarily a vineyard source rather than an estate winery, its fruit is sought after by acclaimed producers like Van Duzer Vineyards and J. Christopher Wines for single-vineyard bottlings, celebrated for bright red fruit profiles, structured acidity, and distinctive mineral depth.

properties.name: Bjornson McMinnville Tasting Room
properties.description: The Björnson McMinnville Tasting Room offers a convenient urban setting in historic downtown McMinnville to experience wines crafted at the family estate vineyard. The actual vineyard is nestled in the Eola-Amity Hills, where it is known for expressive, terroir-driven Pinot Noir and Chardonnay grown through committed sustainable practices.

properties.name: Björnson Vineyard
properties.address: 3635 Bethel Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: This family-owned estate in the northern Eola-Amity Hills combines panoramic views with innovative winemaking, crafting acclaimed Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and rare Gouais Blanc, the only commercial producer of this ancient grape in the Western Hemisphere. Renowned for sustainability, it holds LIVE certification, a Salmon-Safe Hero Award, and utilizes wind/solar energy across its scenic 107-acre property, offering flights in labeled beakers amid forests and conservation lands.

properties.name: Blakeslee Vineyard Estate
properties.description: This LIVE-certified estate in the Chehalem Mountains produces award-winning Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and the unique White Pinot Noir from dry-farmed Laurelwood soils. Located just 20 minutes from Portland, the atrium-style tasting room features panoramic views of the valley and Mount Hood.

properties.name: Bledsoe|McDaniels Winery
properties.description: Founded by former NFL quarterback Drew Bledsoe and acclaimed winemaker Josh McDaniels, this estate-driven winery crafts limited-production Pinot Noir from its Coulee Estate Vineyard in the Eola-Amity Hills, alongside Walla Walla Valley Syrah. Known for sustainable farming, private tastings with Mount Hood views, and McDaniels' 'Top 40 Under 40' recognition.

properties.name: Blizzard Wines & Vineyard
properties.description: Blizzard Wines crafts elegant Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its estate vineyard, expressing a cool-climate character. The winery is also known for its bold, Bordeaux-inspired reds from Columbia Valley vineyards and offers a selection of artisan grower Champagnes.

properties.name: Bluebird Hill Cellars
properties.description: Bluebird Hill Cellars is a small, family-owned winery founded in 2014 on a scenic hilltop near Monroe, known for its panoramic views and handcrafted, award-winning Pinot Noir and Chardonnay aged 24 months in barrel. Recognized as a 'rising star' with nine Platinum awards in five years, it was named 2024 Oregon Winery to Watch and collaborates with WNBA star Elena Delle Donne.

properties.name: Borgo Pass Vineyards
properties.description: Nestled in the forested foothills near Alpine, Oregon, this remote, earth-friendly vineyard grows cool-climate Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and Cabernet Sauvignon on 1970s-era vines, supplying acclaimed winemakers like Teutonic and Bow & Arrow with fruit known for savory, lean characteristics. It embraces a playful Dracula-themed identity, named after the novel’s castle approach, with a rustic tasting room featuring bat decor and a 'reflection-checking' mirror.

properties.name: Boring Winery & Taproom
properties.description: Boring Winery & Taproom offers a vibrant blend of estate wines, local craft beers, and ciders in a relaxed setting highlighted by scenic outdoor spaces draped with grapevines and hops. Known for its crisp, dry Chardonnay and charcuterie boards, this welcoming venue doubles as an event space for gatherings amid its cozy, family-friendly ambiance.

properties.name: Bracken Vineyard
properties.address: 5887 Orchard Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: A high-elevation (630–750 ft), organically and biodynamically farmed estate in the Eola-Amity Hills, known for its volcanic soils, cool-climate focus, and diverse plantings of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Aligoté, and Pinot Meunier. Its mineral-driven, high-acidity wines, crafted by owner Shelby Perkins and collaborative winemakers like Walter Scott, express precise terroir through old-world elegance and limited-production bottlings.

properties.name: Bravuro Cellars
properties.description: Bravuro Cellars is a winery specializing in small-batch, bold red wines from hot-climate varieties, a distinct profile for the region. Sourcing grapes from outside the area, this family-run operation produces award-winning wines and was ranked among the ten best wineries in Oregon.

properties.name: Bravuro Cellars Vineyard
properties.description: Bravuro Cellars Vineyard stands out for its daring production of robust, hot-climate reds like Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon, a bold contrast to the region's Pinot Noir focus. Their hillside estate offers sweeping valley views and a uniquely spirited tasting experience, which really reflects their award-winning, handcrafted approach.

properties.name: Brick House Vineyards
properties.address: 18200 NE Lewis Rogers Ln, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: This pioneering biodynamic vineyard farms estate Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Gamay Noir in a 90-year-old converted barn on working farmland. Founder Doug Tunnell, a self-taught winemaker, has earned a national following for exceptional wines and commitment to organic and regenerative farming practices.

properties.name: Brigadoon Wine Co
properties.description: Brigadoon Wine Co. is a family-owned estate in the Willamette Valley's foothills near Junction City, known for organic viticulture and minimalist winemaking. Founded by the Shown family, it produces acclaimed Pinot Noir, Riesling (among Oregon's best), and Pinot Blanc, with a scenic tasting room and picnic grounds overlooking their vineyards.

properties.name: Brittan Vineyards McMinnville Tasting Room
properties.description: While the tasting room is situated in McMinnville's historic Granary District, the actual Brittan Vineyard is located on a 128-acre hillside estate approximately 12 miles away within the McMinnville AVA . This cool, windswept site with its unique basalt-based soils is known for producing excellent earth-driven, single-block Pinot Noirs, Estate Chardonnay, and small lots of Syrah.

properties.name: Broadley Vineyards
properties.description: Founded in 1986, Broadley Vineyards is a family-owned estate winery located in the center of Monroe, right on Highway 99W, featuring a scenic tasting room with river views and a seasonal patio overlooking the Long Tom River. Known for its sustainably farmed, dry-farmed 33-acre vineyard, it produces multiple acclaimed Pinot Noirs, Gamay Noir, Chardonnay, and Pinot Gris. Broadly was also the first vineyard in Oregon to receive 97 points back in 1994 for its 'Claudia's Choice' Pinot Noir, which they held for multiple decades.

properties.name: Brooks Wine
properties.address: 21101 SE Cherry Blossom Ln, Amity, OR 97101
properties.description: This family-run, biodynamic developer is known for its acclaimed Rieslings and Pinot Noirs, crafted with sustainable practices since 1998. The winery offers a scenic tasting room with mountain views and holds Demeter Biodynamic and B Corp certifications, reflecting its commitment to environmental stewardship.

properties.name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards
properties.address: 5935 Bethel Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: Perched atop a windswept hill in the Eola-Amity Hills, this family-owned estate is celebrated for its LIVE-certified sustainable farming and nationally acclaimed Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. The hilltop tasting room offers panoramic views, while experimental wines like Riesling, Dolcetto, and méthode champenoise sparklings highlight its innovative spirit.

properties.name: Campbell Lane Winery
properties.address: 27411 SW Campbell Ln, West Linn, OR 97068
properties.description: Family-operated estate crafting acclaimed Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and unique oak-aged White Pinot Noir from their historic hillside vineyards, sustainably farmed since 1966. Renowned for its tranquil tasting room with panoramic Mt. Hood views, dog-friendly lawns, vineyard picnics, and lively events in a converted solarium just 25 minutes from Portland.

properties.name: Cana's Feast Winery
properties.description: Cana's Feast Winery is known for its bold, food-friendly wines inspired by European styles, producing a diverse portfolio of Italian, Bordeaux, and Rhône-style varietals alongside Pacific Northwest selections. The winery sources fruit from highly regarded vineyards in both the Willamette Valley and eastern Washington.

properties.name: Capitello Wines
properties.description: Founded by New Zealand-born winemaker Ray Walsh, this urban winery crafts innovative Oregon and New Zealand varietals, like concrete-aged Sauvignon Blanc and oak-fermented Pinot Noir, showcasing experimental techniques such as reverse osmosis for alcohol adjustment. Its relaxed Eugene tasting room offers globally inspired flights and food pairings, reflecting Walsh’s dual-hemisphere harvest philosophy and hands-on approach.

properties.name: Carabella Vineyard
properties.description: Carabella Vineyard is a family-owned estate known for its elegant, site-expressive Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Pinot Gris. The vineyard walk and tasting offers a unique, firsthand exploration of its volcanic geology and sustainable viticulture, culminating with library wines enjoyed amid sweeping valley views.

properties.name: Cardwell Hill Cellars
properties.description: Cardwell Hill Cellars is a family-owned winery founded in 2000 north of Philomath, known for its award-winning estate Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris grown on sustainably dry-farmed vineyards with volcanic soils and certified by Salmon Safe and LIVE for environmental stewardship. The scenic property offers panoramic views of Mary’s Peak, a pet-friendly tasting room, bocce ball, picnic areas, and over 645 accolades, including Wine Spectator Top 100 recognition.

properties.name: Carlo & Julian Winery
properties.description: Carlo & Julian is an estate winery known for its range of farm wines, including age-worthy Pinot Noir and an innovative selection of Tempranillo and Merlot. The vineyard, first planted in 1991, features unique soil and a warm microclimate that contribute to the wines' structure and aging potential.

properties.name: Carlton Hill Wine Company
properties.description: Carlton Hill Wine Company is a small, family-run estate producing Pinot Noir and méthode champenoise sparkling wine from its LIVE certified sustainable vineyard. Tastings are held by appointment in a historic barn, offering a rustic experience complemented by a hilltop croquet court and scenic valley views.

properties.name: Carson Phillips Vineyards
properties.description: Carson Phillips Vineyards is a family-owned estate in the Dundee Hills, founded by three brothers and focused on organic and dry-farmed viticulture. The winery produces Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Gamay Noir from its own vineyard and other distinguished sites.

properties.name: Cathedral Ridge Winery
properties.description: Cathedral Ridge Winery crafts its portfolio of bold reds and signature blends from grapes sourced through partnerships with over a dozen vineyards in the Columbia Gorge region. This acclaimed winery was named the 2024 Oregon Winery of the Year and produces over 30 different wines in a traditional, small-batch style.

properties.name: Chatterbox Vineyard
properties.address: 34094 SW Ladd Hill Rd, Wilsonville, OR 97070
properties.description: Chatterbox Vineyard is a 10.5-acre estate on Parrett Mountain known for its focus on vineyard quality, growing four distinct clones of Pinot Noir and two of Chardonnay. The vineyard is dry-farmed, a practice that encourages deep root growth, and offers visitors tours by appointment with views of Mount Hood.

properties.name: Chehalem Estate Tasting Room
properties.description: Chehalem's estate tasting room overlooks its vineyard, which is planted to a diverse array of varieties including numerous Pinot Noir clones, Chardonnay, and Grüner Veltliner. The winery is known for a minimalist approach to winemaking and holds B Corp, LIVE Certified, and Salmon Safe sustainability certifications.

properties.name: Chemeketa Cellars
properties.address: 215 Doaks Ferry Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: A student-run teaching winery and vineyard at Chemeketa Community College’s Northwest Wine Studies Center. Known for award-winning, small-lot wines like Pinot Noir and Gamay Noir crafted by students, it features a tasting room with valley views, seasonal events, and hands-on viticulture education.

properties.name: Cherry Hill Winery
properties.description: A boutique estate spanning 150 acres atop the 45th parallel, renowned for its sustainably farmed, Pommard-clone Pinot Noir from volcanic slopes at 250–450 ft elevation. The chateau-inspired tasting room offers panoramic vineyard and hill views, rustic elegance, and acclaimed small-lot wines crafted with minimal intervention.

properties.name: CHO Wines
properties.description: Oregon's first Korean-American winery, CHO Wines produces high-elevation Pinot Noir and innovative sparkling wines using both traditional and natural methods. The rapidly rising producer has earned 90+ scores from major critics while crafting wines with distinct character from its uniquely cool vineyard sites.

properties.name: Chris James Cellars
properties.address: 12000 NW Old Wagon Rd, Carlton, OR 97111
properties.description: Chris James Cellars is a family-owned winery known for a diverse portfolio of both classic Pinot Noir and unique offerings like Lagrein and Dolcetto from its estate vineyard, alongside bold reds from the Columbia Valley. The winery provides tasting experiences at its two locations: a vineyard estate and a tasting room in McMinnville.

properties.name: Chris James Cellars McMinnville Tasting Room
properties.description: The McMinnville Tasting Room offers an urban wine experience in the heart of downtown, serving as a welcoming venue for the family-owned estate. The actual vineyard is in the foothills of the Coastal Range near Carlton, a 62-acre property known for its diverse plantings of 16 varietals and creative, award-winning wines.

properties.name: Christopher Bridge Wines
properties.address: 12770 S Casto Rd, Oregon City, OR 97045
properties.description: Family-operated estate winery specializing in cool-climate varietals like Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris, alongside unique offerings including Grüner Veltliner, Blaufränkisch, and award-winning Muscat, all estate-grown at Satori Springs Vineyard. Known for intimate tastings in a scenic timberframe setting and multiple Double Gold medal-winning vintages reflecting their sustainable, terroir-driven philosophy.

properties.name: Civic Winery & Wines
properties.description: This urban winery operates from a restored 1930s building, housing a production facility, natural wine bar, and the Lion & Owl restaurant. It specializes in organic and biodynamic wines fermented in Oregon-made terra cotta amphorae, emphasizing transparency and minimal intervention, while also offering event space and custom-crush services.

properties.name: Claygate Vineyard
properties.description: This small-production estate produces fewer than 700 cases annually of Pinot Noir grown on Ribbon Ridge's ancient marine sediment soils. The family name dates to 1086 and their historic crest adorns each label, while the tasting room offers expansive views from a covered patio.

properties.name: Cliff Creek Cellars
properties.description: Cliff Creek Cellars in Newberg is a tasting room for wines handcrafted from estate-grown grapes sourced from the family's own 70-acre Sam's Valley Vineyard in Southern Oregon. The winery is known for its bold, age-worthy red wines such as Claret and Syrah, reflecting a multi-generational family farming legacy.

properties.name: Clos Griotte Vineyard
properties.address: 20700 SE Cherry Blossom Ln, Amity, OR 97101
properties.description: Focusing exclusively on expressive Pinot Noir, this boutique producer crafts distinctive wines like its McMinnville Cuvée from biodynamically farmed, high-elevation vineyards such as Hyland and Momtazi. Known for innovative techniques, including unconventional sparkling wine packaging and unique bottlings like Pinot Noir Blanc. This site really emphasizes site-driven character and sustainable practices.

properties.name: Coelho Winery
properties.description: Coelho Winery is a family-owned winery known for producing estate-grown Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Pinot Gris exclusively from its own vineyards. This approach guarantees quality from vineyard to table, with their tasting room serving as a community anchor in a historic building.

properties.name: Coeur De Terre Vineyard
properties.address: 21000 SW Eagle Point Rd, McMinnville, OR 97128
properties.description: Coeur de Terre Vineyard is a family-owned estate specializing in organically farmed, site-expressive Pinot Noirs and cool-climate Syrah from their diverse vineyard blocks. Guests are welcomed by friendly dogs to a relaxed tasting experience on the deck, enjoying views of the protective valley that shapes their graceful wines.

properties.name: Coleman Vineyard
properties.description: Coleman Vineyard is a cherished family farm crafting elegant Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris from their historic, dry-farmed estate vines. Their wines are known for smooth structure and signature dark cherry richness, a pure expression of the unique volcanic soils and coastal winds shaping their terroir.

properties.name: Colene Clemens Vineyards
properties.description: A 122-acre family-owned estate planted to Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, Colene Clemens combines volcanic and sedimentary soils across elevations of 350 to 650 feet. The dry-farmed vineyard emphasizes sustainable practices and is managed by longtime winemaker Stephen Goff with dedication to producing exceptional wines.

properties.name: Compris Vineyard
properties.description: Compris Vineyard is a small, owner-operated estate with a 12.5-acre, organically farmed vineyard (LIVE and Salmon-Safe certified) planted to Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Viognier, plus rare Syrah and Tempranillo. Known for inclusive leadership and intimate hillside tastings with views, it focuses on high quality, site-driven wines.

properties.name: Compton Family Wines
properties.description: Compton Family Wines is a family-owned winery founded in 2003 in Philomath, Oregon, known for its minimal-intervention approach and regenerative farming practices like dry farming and no tilling to produce terroir-driven Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and Pinot Blanc. Their wines, acclaimed for varietal purity and value, have earned ratings above 93 points, 'Best Buy' accolades from Wine Spectator, and multiple gold medals at Oregon festivals.

properties.name: Cooper Mountain Vineyards
properties.description: Cooper Mountain Vineyards is a pioneer of organic and biodynamic viticulture, crafting estate-grown wines from its five estate vineyards. The winery produces a range of varietals with a particular focus on Pinot Noir, all expressing the character of their sustainably farmed land.

properties.name: Corcilla Cellars
properties.description: This humble urban winery in downtown Oregon City sources premium grapes from top West Coast vineyards to craft approachable wines with creative twists on classic varietals. The cozy, pet-friendly tasting room features a vibrant atmosphere designed to make wine accessible and enjoyable for everyone.

properties.name: Cória Estates
properties.description: Cória Estates is a Mexican-American family-owned vineyard and winery in South Salem's Willamette Valley, renowned for its 104-acre estate, panoramic views, and handcrafted stone architecture amid palm trees. Founded in 1988 and operated by winemaker Aurora Coria, it crafts acclaimed Pinot Noir (including a 97-point vintage), Alsace-style whites, and sparkling wines using holistic methods, while hosting culturally infused events like Taco Tuesdays and sunset concerts.

properties.name: Corollary Wines
properties.description: Dedicated exclusively to traditional-method sparkling wines, this innovative estate crafts terroir-driven cuvées from sustainably farmed vineyards like Cattrall Brothers and X-Omni, emphasizing clonal diversity and cool-climate acidity. Its award-winning red tasting pavilion, opened in 2024, offers panoramic views, rainwater-harvesting design, and intimate winemaker-led experiences on a 57-acre regenerative estate.

properties.name: Corral Creek Vineyard
properties.description: Planted in 1983 on Laurelwood soils in the Chehalem Mountains, this 40-acre estate surrounds Chehalem Winery and was acquired from the Howieson family. Known for producing elegant Pinot Noir with bright red fruit characteristics and graceful tannins from its Pommard and Wädenswil vines.

properties.name: Cramoisi Vineyard
properties.address: 8670 NE Worden Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: Cramoisi Vineyard is a micro boutique winery in the Dundee Hills, producing under 800 cases of estate-grown Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its own organic and biodynamic farm. The owner-operated winery is known for its hands-on approach and offers intimate tasting experiences with stunning views of the Willamette Valley.

properties.name: Cristom Vineyards
properties.address: 6905 Spring Valley Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: A pioneering, family-owned estate founded in 1992 and now led by second-generation owner Tom Gerrie, renowned for its terroir-driven, single-vineyard Pinot Noirs named after family matriarchs (Marjorie, Louise, Jessie, Eileen), crafted with native yeasts and high whole-cluster fermentation. Certified sustainable (LIVE) and transitioning to biodynamic farming, its 90-acre estate in the volcanic Eola-Amity Hills yields acclaimed Chardonnay, Pinot Gris, and Rhône-style wines, celebrated for structure, ageability, and a distinct mineral profile shaped by coastal winds.

properties.name: Crowley Wines
properties.description: Founded in 2005 by Tyson Crowley, who trained at Cameron Winery, this producer crafts Burgundy-influenced Pinot Noir and Chardonnay with minimal intervention techniques. A member of the Deep Roots Coalition, the winery sources from high-elevation, dry-farmed sites and produces wines at the August Cellars facility.

properties.name: Cubanisimo Vineyards
properties.description: A family-owned boutique winery celebrating Cuban heritage through its 'very Cuban' ethos, crafting acclaimed Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and Rosado from estate-grown fruit in the Eola-Amity Hills. The scenic tasting room offers panoramic valley and mountain views, lively salsa events, and Cuban-inspired holiday celebrations with tapas and live music.

properties.name: Cynthian Vineyards
properties.description: Specializing in premium Pinot Noir (Pommard and 777 clones) and Gamay, this 10,669-vine estate focuses exclusively on grape cultivation without a public tasting room or winery . Its fruit is highly sought after, notably supplying acclaimed producers like Failla for their site-specific bottlings from the Van Duzer Corridor.

properties.name: Darque Wines
properties.description: This boutique winery, established in 2018, specializes in hand-crafted small-lot wines reflecting the Pacific Northwest’s character, notably its non-vintage Rescue Red Blend and Willamette Valley Pinot Noir. Known for artisanal production and a welcoming tasting room in Turner, it offers wine club memberships with exclusive releases and discounts.

properties.name: David Paige Wines
properties.address: 18271 SE Walnut Hill Rd, Amity, OR 97101
properties.description: Founded by a veteran winemaker, David Paige Wines crafts beautifully textured Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Their handcrafted approach yields expressive, nuanced bottles that speak eloquently of the land, offering a pure and authentic taste of the vineyard's unique character.

properties.name: Day Wines
properties.description: Day Wines produces a diverse range of boutique wines from grapes sourced through dedicated partnerships with growers across Oregon's AVAs, including the Willamette and Applegate Valleys. This small-scale winery is recognized for its creative blends and minimalist approach, with a tasting room located in Dundee for visitors.

properties.name: Denison Cellars Tasting Room
properties.address: 1245 NE Alpha Dr Unit 2C, McMinnville, OR 97128
properties.description: Denison Cellars is a boutique, family-run winery known for its elegant, single-vineyard wines sourced from distinctive, sustainably-farmed sites. The tasting room offers a relaxed experience in downtown McMinnville, featuring flights of its acclaimed Pinot Noir and Chardonnay alongside unique offerings such as Syrah and a Tempranillo port-style wine.

properties.name: De Ponte Cellars
properties.address: 17545 NE Archery Summit Rd, Dayton, OR 97114
properties.description: De Ponte Cellars is a family-owned estate in the Dundee Hills, home to one of the region's oldest vineyards. It is renowned for its elegant, Burgundian-style Pinot Noir and its award-winning, rare Old Vine Melon, crafted by a French winemaker from a storied tradition.

properties.name: Dion Vineyard
properties.description: Started in 1973 and now in its third generation, this small winery tends 60 acres with vineyard sections dating to 1976, producing limited quantities of Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and Sparkling wines. The family operation supplies premium fruit to other valley wineries while pursuing sustainability through L.I.V.E. certification and dry-farming.

properties.name: Dobbes Family Winery
properties.description: Dobbes Family Winery operates as a larger-scale producer with a diverse portfolio of Pinot Noir and Syrah, sourcing fruit from its estate vineyards and partner sites across the region. The winery holds LIVE and Salmon Safe certifications for its sustainable practices and produces a range of wines from single-vineyard designates to broader cuvées. Through its Dundee Vintners division, it also provides custom winemaking services for other labels.

properties.name: Domaine 524 & Prophet Vineyard
properties.address: 6049 Bethel Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: Domaine 524 crafts small-batch, single-vineyard Pinot Noir exclusively from its 11-acre LIVE and Salmon Safe-certified Prophet Vineyard, leveraging volcanic and marine sedimentary soils cooled by Van Duzer Corridor winds. This sustainably farmed estate is celebrated for terroir-driven wines and offers appointment-only tastings amid scenic views.

properties.name: Domaine Divio
properties.address: 16435 NE Lewis Rogers Ln, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: Fourth-generation Burgundian winemaker Bruno Corneaux founded this estate in 2014, naming it after Dijon's ancient Roman designation and selecting Ribbon Ridge for its similarities to his hometown near Beaune. Known for award-winning Chardonnays and Burgundian-style Pinot Noirs, the biodynamically farmed Clos Gallia estate produces minimal-intervention wines.

properties.name: Domaine Drouhin
properties.address: 6750 NE Breyman Orchards Rd, Dayton, OR 97114
properties.description: Domaine Drouhin is an esteemed Dundee Hills estate of the Burgundian Drouhin family, known for producing elegant, terroir-driven Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its 235-acre property. The winery is distinguished for its four-level gravity-flow facility and offers a tasting experience with breathtaking views over the valley.

properties.name: Domaine Lumineux Tasting Room
properties.description: Domaine Lumineux Tasting Room in downtown Newberg offers wines made exclusively from fruit grown on the winery's own 42-acre, LIVE Certified sustainable vineyard in the Dundee Hills. This estate-focused approach shows the quality characteristic of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Pinot Gris from their high-elevation site.

properties.name: Domaine Roy & fils
properties.address: 8351 NE Worden Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: Domaine Roy & fils is a small estate winery crafting Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its own organically farmed vineyards in the Dundee Hills and Yamhill-Carlton AVAs. With total production under 4,000 cases annually, the winery is known for a minimalist approach that allows the distinct character of its iron-rich volcanic and ancient marine sedimentary soils to define the wines.

properties.name: Domaine Serene
properties.description: Domaine Serene is a pioneering estate winery recognized for its acclaimed Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, grown across its seven distinct LIVE Certified sustainable vineyards. The winery is known for its hilltop Clubhouse offering sweeping views and a legacy of crafting top quality wines that express the unique character of its diverse terroir.

properties.name: Domaine Willamette
properties.description: Domaine Willamette is a winery dedicated to crafting méthode traditionnelle sparkling wines from its biodynamically farmed Bernau Estate Vineyard in the Dundee Hills. The modern facility, with its underground aging cellar and gardens inspired by biodynamic principles, offers a sophisticated setting for enjoying these elegant wines.

properties.name: Duck Pond Cellars
properties.description: Duck Pond Cellars is a family-owned winery producing over 130,000 cases from its estate vineyards and is known for crafting a wide range of quality, accessible wines. Founded in 1993, it provides a welcoming tasting experience with food pairings in a setting that includes a peaceful deck area beside a pond.

properties.name: Dukes Family Vineyards
properties.description: Nestled in the Eola-Amity Hills, this family-owned estate is known for its exceptional, sustainably farmed Pinot Noir and LIVE certified, Salmon Safe practices. The scenic vineyard offers tastings with panoramic views, cheese pairings, and immersive private tours hosted by the owners themselves.

properties.name: Durant Vineyards Tasting Room
properties.address: 5430 NE Breyman Orchards Rd, Dayton, OR 97114
properties.description: Durant Vineyards is a family-owned estate in the Dundee Hills, known for its Pinot Noir and Chardonnay grown since 1973. The tasting room at Red Ridge Farms offers panoramic valley views and shares the property with Oregon's first commercial olive mill with a diverse agricultural heritage.

properties.name: Dusky Goose
properties.description: Dusky Goose is a small-production estate winery founded by Lynn Penner-Ash, crafting acclaimed Pinot Noir and Chardonnay just outside downtown Dundee. The winery is known for its LIVE Certified Sustainable practices and offers intimate tasting experiences nestled within its Rambouillet Vineyard.

properties.name: Élevée Winegrowers
properties.description: Élevée Winegrowers is a family-owned estate and winery known for its terroir-focused Pinot Noir from high-density vineyards. Their approach integrates certified sustainable farming with winemaking, producing small lots that express the distinct character of their sites.

properties.name: Elizabeth Chambers Cellar
properties.description: This boutique winery specializes in handcrafted, micro-regional Pinot Noir sourced from prestigious vineyards like Shea and Lazy River, reflecting the distinct terroir of its sites. Known for its butterfly emblem symbolizing transformation, the winery offers exclusive small-lot releases and operates a chic tasting lounge in Eugene.

properties.name: Elton Vineyards
properties.description: Elton Vineyards, founded in 1983 by Dick and Betty O’Brien, is a renowned site in the Eola-Amity Hills known for its old-vine, self-rooted Pinot Noir and Chardonnay plantings. Celebrated as one of Oregon’s top vineyards, its high-elevation slopes (250–635 ft) and Jory soils yield critically acclaimed wines, including limited single-block bottlings scoring 90+ points.

properties.name: Eminent Domaine
properties.address: 20875 NE Ribbon Ridge Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: This family-owned estate vineyard specializes in Pinot Noir and Chardonnay with a focus on quality and careful vineyard selection. The tasting room offers panoramic views and warm hospitality, making it an inviting destination for those seeking well-crafted wines in an intimate setting.

properties.name: Eola Hills Legacy Estate Vineyard
properties.description: A scenic destination since the 1980s, this sustainably farmed estate spans over 300 acres in the Eola-Amity Hills, celebrated for its reserve-tier Pinot Noir, sparkling wines, and panoramic valley vistas. The rustic-chic tasting room features expansive lawns, lakeside picnics, seasonal hiking trails ('Wiking'), and hosted events amid native oaks and vineyard views.

properties.name: Eola Hills Wine Cellars
properties.address: 501 S Pacific Hwy W, Rickreall, OR 97371
properties.description: Operating since 1986, Eola Hills Wine Cellars grows diverse varietals like Pinot Noir and Chardonnay across sustainably farmed estate vineyards in the Eola-Amity Hills AVA. This original Rickreall tasting room, located outside of the Eola-Hills AVA, features barrel-room ambiance, garden seating, and chef-paired offerings alongside a broad portfolio of classic and reserve wines.

properties.name: Et Fille Wines
properties.description: Et Fille Wines is a family-founded winery known for its elegantly complex Pinot Noir, Viognier, and sparkling wines, crafted from sustainably farmed vineyards across several AVAs. Now led by second-generation daughter Jessica Mozeico, this B Corp Certified winery is recognized for its high-scoring wines and a legacy that spans from father to daughter.

properties.name: Eugene Wine Cellars
properties.description: Founded in 2000 as the city’s first urban winery, this family-operated venture leverages founder Bruce Biehl’s five-decade expertise in vineyard development to produce 30,000 annual cases of its acclaimed b2 wines, specializing in small-lot fermentations and vineyard blends like Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. Beyond its own labels, it provides custom winemaking services and private-label production for prominent regional wineries, operating from a revitalized facility in Eugene’s Whiteaker neighborhood.

properties.name: Evening Land Vineyards
properties.address: 4180 Lone Star Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: Stewarding the historic, biodynamic Seven Springs Vineyard in the Eola-Amity Hills since 2014, this acclaimed estate crafts terroir-driven Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Gamay celebrated for their elegance and complexity, with single-block bottlings like La Source and Summum showcasing its distinct volcanic soils and Van Duzer Corridor winds. Renowned for panoramic views of Cascade peaks and intimate sommelier-led tastings, it pioneers Oregon’s Burgundian varieties while holding LIVE certification and earning recognition among North America’s top Chardonnay producers.

properties.name: Evesham Wood Vineyard
properties.description: A pioneering, family-owned estate founded in 1986 and now led by a second generation, renowned for its organic, dry-farmed 'Le Puits Sec' vineyard and Burgundian-style Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Alsatian varietals. It crafts age-worthy, terroir-driven wines from its estate and acclaimed sites like Temperance Hill, emphasizing minimal intervention and consistent value.

properties.name: Festive Hill Winery & Vineyards
properties.address: 20100 SW Johnson Rd, West Linn, OR 97068
properties.description: This family-run estate spans 20 acres and produces all wines from grapes grown onsite. The 10,000-square-foot tasting center features wrap-around decks with panoramic views and emphasizes an approachable, welcoming atmosphere for wine enthusiasts and newcomers alike.

properties.name: Five Fourteen Vineyards
properties.description: Five Fourteen Vineyards is a scenic, family-owned estate in Oregon's Willamette Valley, renowned for its LIVE-certified sustainable vineyards and panoramic views of the Coburg Hills from its hillside location near Eugene. This boutique winery specializes in limited-production, estate-grown Pinot Noir, acclaimed Sauvignon Blanc (frequently selling out), and sparkling wines crafted by renowned winemaker Drew Voit, with exclusive releases reserved for wine club members.

properties.name: Flanerie Vineyard
properties.address: 17550 NE Lewis Rogers Ln, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: This 10-acre dry-farmed estate vineyard was planted in 2003 on Ribbon Ridge's marine sedimentary Willakenzie soils mixed with glacial stones from ancient floods. Known for producing spicy, savory, age-worthy Pinot Noir from its east-facing slopes, wines from this site are tasted at Flâneur Wines' locations in Carlton and at La Belle Promenade.

properties.name: Flâneur Wines
properties.description: Flâneur Wines crafts terroir-driven Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its two organic, dry-farmed estate vineyards, La Belle Promenade in the Chehalem Mountains and Flanerie Vineyard on Ribbon Ridge. The winery offers tastings in a renovated historic grain elevator and an 80-year-old barn with vineyard views, embodying a philosophy of leisurely discovery.

properties.name: Forest Edge Vineyard
properties.address: 15640 S Spangler Rd, Oregon City, OR 97045
properties.description: Small estate winery in the Cascade foothills practicing permaculture farming to craft distinctive wines like sparkling Chardonnay and dessert-style Sucré Chardonnay, expressing their unique forest-edge terroir. Offers free weekend tastings amid scenic, sustainably designed facilities with picnic areas, bike-friendly amenities, and pet-friendly hospitality.

properties.name: Fox Farm Vineyards
properties.description: Fox Farm Vineyards produces Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its own dry-farmed estate vineyards in the Dundee Hills, complemented by fruit sourced from other local sites. Their winemaking focusses a minimalist approach to create wines that express the character of these specific vineyards.

properties.name: Freja Cellars
properties.description: Freja Cellars is a family-owned estate winery with vines climbing a steep Laurelwood-soil slope, producing small-lot, terroir-driven Pinot Noir alongside limited Albariño and rosé. Its intimate setting and hands-on approach create quietly expressive wines that highlight site, elevation, and thoughtful, traditional cellar work.

properties.name: Furioso Vineyards
properties.address: 8415 NE Worden Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: Furioso Vineyards is an estate winery with deep Italian roots, crafting small-lot Pinot Noir and Chardonnay through wild fermentations in a striking, modern tasting room nestled. It is known for its panoramic views and architecture, named one of the world's most beautiful wineries, offering an experience centered on art, wine, and family.

properties.name: Gemini Vineyards
properties.description: Gemini Vineyards is a family-owned estate known for producing Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Pinot Gris, and Gamay Noir from its LIVE certified sustainable vineyards. The winery offers an intimate, appointment-only tasting experience held at an outdoor pergola surrounded by its estate vines.

properties.name: Granville Wine Co.
properties.description: Granville Wine Co. is an appointment only family-run winery founded by second-generation growers. It focuses on site-expressive Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its organically farmed estate and partner vineyards. The winery is recognized for its precise, terroir-driven wines that have garnered significant critical acclaim.

properties.name: Greyhorse Vineyard
properties.description: This small 2.75-acre organic estate was first planted in 1998 with own-rooted Pommard clone Pinot Noir and now includes Dijon 115 and Chardonnay. The family-run vineyard supplies premium fruit to several wineries and was named after the original owners' grey Arabian horse.

properties.name: Guillén Family Wines
properties.description: Guillén Family Wines continues the legacy of founder Jesús Guillén, a self-taught winemaker known for Pinot Noir made with native yeast and 100% whole-cluster fermentation. This small, family-operated estate focuses on limited production wines, often named for family members, that emphasize complexity and harmony.

properties.name: Haakon / Lenai Vineyard
properties.address: 10555 NE Red Hills Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: Haakon / Lenai is a family-owned estate vineyard and winery known for its certified organic farming and limited production of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Its tasting room is situated within the vineyard, offering wines crafted exclusively from the estate and an immersive visitor experience.

properties.name: Hamacher Wines
properties.description: Founded in 1995, Hamacher produces small-lot, hand-crafted Pinot Noir and Chardonnay with a focus on quality over quantity, approximately 2,000 cases annually. The winery sources grapes from diverse vineyard sites at varying elevations throughout the valley, creating wines of remarkable complexity and depth.

properties.name: Hanson Vineyards
properties.description: This fourth-generation family estate winery operates sustainably with low-intervention methods, growing 12 cool-climate varieties like Gamay and Gewürztraminer alongside Pinot Noir across its scenic vineyards. Known for a cozy, rustic tasting room and welcoming picnic-friendly atmosphere, it offers unfussy, hands-on hospitality where visitors often meet the owners themselves.

properties.name: Harper Voit Wines
properties.description: Harper Voit is known for its obsessively crafted, terroir-driven single-vineyard Pinot Noirs sourced from distinctive sites like the Dundee Hills, Eola-Amity Hills, and Ribbon Ridge. The winemaking philosophy focuses on minimal intervention to express the unique character of each vineyard, resulting in wines of complexity and a profound sense of place.

properties.name: Harris Bridge Vineyard LLC
properties.description: Harris Bridge Vineyard LLC is a small, family-owned winery and distillery west of Corvallis, it is renowned for its innovative dessert wines, vermouths, and brandies crafted through a unique freezing process that preserves acidity and complexity. Nestled near the Mary's River and the historic Harris Covered Bridge, it offers a scenic tasting experience with picnic areas, lawn games, and Salmon-Safe certified practices.

properties.name: Hauer of the Dauen Winery
properties.description: Hauer of the Dauen Winery is a family-owned estate, founded by Carl and Lores Dauenhauer, which has cultivated its 110-acre vineyard since 1980. The boutique winery produces around 4,000 cases annually from its Dayton vineyard, known for a diverse range including Pinot Noir, Riesling, and unique offerings like a Pinot Noir dessert wine.

properties.name: Hawks View Winery
properties.description: Hawks View Winery is a sustainably farmed, family-run estate known for its exceptional Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Pinot Gris. The winery offers a world-class tasting experience with panoramic views of its vineyards and the Chehalem Mountains from its elegant and inviting tasting rooms.

properties.name: Hayworth Estate Wines
properties.description: Hayworth Estate Wines is a scenic Willamette Valley vineyard north of Eugene, known for its sweeping Coburg Hills views and unique football field surrounded by vines. This family-farmed estate produces handcrafted varietals like Pinot Noir and Gamay, hosts popular events like Rosé Day, and offers a collaboration line (LeVox Wines) with country artist Gary LeVox.

properties.name: Hazelfern
properties.description: Founded by a husband-and-wife winemaking team, this boutique winery crafts small-lot Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and the occasional Syrah with a focus on expressive terroir and vibrant energy. Set in a historic barn tasting room, Hazelfern delivers wines that reflect both approachable flair and thoughtful site specificity.

properties.name: heaVin Estate Vineyard & Wines
properties.description: Family-owned heaVin Estate Vineyard in handcrafts small-lot wines exclusively from estate-grown grapes, with all fruit meticulously hand-pruned and harvested since 2002. This boutique winery is known for vintage-driven expressions where annual weather variations create unique terroir-reflective profiles in each bottle.

properties.name: High Pass Winery
properties.description: High Pass Winery is a family-owned estate nestled in the forested Coast Range foothills near Junction City, Oregon, established in 1984 by East German immigrant Dieter Boehm. Renowned for pioneering rare German white varieties like Scheurebe and Huxelrebe, smuggled as cuttings from Germany, this boutique winery produces acclaimed Pinot Noir and innovative blends such as the off-dry 'Crazy 8', while championing the creation of the Lower Long Tom sub-AVA.

properties.name: Holden Farm and Winery
properties.description: Holden Farm and Winery is a small, artisan producer crafting Northern Italian-inspired wines and expressive Pinot Noirs from the most western vineyard in the Willamette Valley. Founded by winemaker Sterling Whitted, the operation is dedicated to a hands-on approach, yielding graceful and nuanced wines that show a deep understanding of site and varietal character that is both unique and familiar to the region.

properties.name: Holloran Vineyard Wines
properties.address: 8795 NE Worden Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: Holloran Vineyard Wines is a small-production estate winery crafting Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its own organically and biodynamically farmed vineyards. It is recognized for its old vines, some dating to the early 1970s, and a winemaking approach that follows Old World traditions to express the pure character of its vineyard sites.

properties.name: Honeywood Winery
properties.description: Honeywood Winery, founded in 1934, is Oregon’s oldest continuously operating winery, renowned for its urban Salem location and extensive range of over 40 wines. It specializes in both fruit-forward offerings like Marionberry and Mead alongside classic vinifera such as Pinot Noir, complemented by a welcoming tasting room and gourmet gift shop.

properties.name: Houston Vineyards Inc
properties.description: Family-owned since 1983, this winery just south of Eugene crafts delicate, cool-climate varietal wines like Chardonnay and Pinot Gris, all without oak or malolactic fermentation. Known for its intimate, appointment-only tastings, it really emphasizes subtle fruit and floral nuances unique to the Willamette Valley.

properties.name: Hudak House - Winery & Vineyard
properties.address: 5737 Orchard Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: A family-owned boutique estate in the Eola-Amity Hills, featuring a 30-acre vineyard with 45-year-old vines growing diverse varietals like Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and Chardonnay. Known for its cozy tasting room with roll-up doors, expansive outdoor concert venue ('Summervine' series), and scenic event spaces ideal for weddings and picnics.

properties.name: Hundred Suns Wine
properties.description: Hundred Suns is an artisanal winery operated solely by the husband-and-wife team of Grant and Renée, who focus on minimal intervention winemaking to create expressive wines from carefully sourced fruit. Their tastings are held in a working warehouse in McMinnville, offering an intimate, garagiste-style experience that shows their precise and acclaimed single-vineyard Pinot Noirs and 'Old Eight Cut' blends.

properties.name: Hyland Estates
properties.description: Hyland Estates is a historic, large-scale estate vineyard dating to 1971, known for its old vines, over 200-acre plantings, and providing fruit for many esteemed Willamette Valley producers. The winery focuses on single-vineyard, estate-grown Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Riesling, and is recognized for its certified sustainable, Biodynamic, and Salmon-Safe farming practices.

properties.name: Illahe Vineyards and Winery
properties.description: This family-owned estate is renowned for its historical, low-intervention winemaking, notably its 'Project 1899' Pinot Noir crafted entirely by hand without electricity or modern machinery, using horse-drawn transport, bicycle pumps, and candlelit barrel aging. Sustainably certified (LIVE/Salmon Safe), the 80-acre vineyard employs draft horses for farming and specializes in terroir-driven Pinot Noir, whites, and rare Italian varietals like Lagrein.

properties.name: Iris Vineyards
properties.description: This estate-grown winery crafts acclaimed Pinot Gris and innovative sparkling wines from its sustainably farmed vineyards, with winemaker Aaron Lieberman leading production since 2008. Beyond its Springfield wine bar, the winery is recognized for pioneering techniques like whole-cluster pressing and producing terroir-driven expressions of southern Willamette Valley sites.

properties.name: Iterum Wines
properties.address: 5917 Orchard Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: Founded by veteran winemaker Joe Dobbes, this boutique estate in the Eola-Amity Hills crafts acclaimed, organically farmed Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its scenic Orchard House Vineyard, leveraging 30+ years of expertise to produce small-lot wines with indigenous yeasts and whole-cluster fermentation. This intimate tasting room offers appointment-only experiences amid panoramic views, featuring limited 'Old Friend' bottlings from Dobbes' long-term vineyard partnerships and earning recognition as Oregon’s '2023 Winery to Watch' for its gold-medal wines.

properties.name: Jachter Family Wines
properties.description: A newly opened ultra-premium estate winery producing Pinot Noir and Chardonnay under winemaker Jared Etzel, also sourcing organically-grown fruit from neighboring Case Vineyard. The 120-acre property features state-of-the-art facilities and diverse volcanic and sedimentary soils with a commitment to sustainable practices.

properties.name: Jackson Family Winery
properties.address: 3500 SE Three Mile Ln, McMinnville, OR 97128
properties.description: Jackson Family Wines operates several esteemed estate wineries in the region, such as Gran Moraine, Zena Crown, and Penner-Ash, which are known for producing distinct, site-expressive Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. While part of a larger family-owned portfolio, these wineries are celebrated for their individual vineyard sites and a winemaking approach that balances scale with an artisan focus on quality.

properties.name: Jacob Williams Winery
properties.description: Jacob Williams Winery is a family-owned boutique winery known for its award-winning red wines, particularly Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, which have earned gold medals and critical acclaim. While it sources grapes from the Columbia Gorge, it offers a tasting experience in a historic downtown setting.

properties.name: J. Christopher Wines
properties.description: J. Christopher Wines is a small winery focusing on Pinot Noir crafted with traditional Burgundian methods and is also known for producing Sauvignon Blanc, a less common variety for the area. The wines are made in an Old World style focussing on balance and are hand-crafted in small lots from locally sourced grapes.

properties.name: JC Somers Vintner
properties.address: 258 N Kutch St Ste A, Carlton, OR 97111
properties.description: JC Somers Vintner is a small winery collaboration between Jay Somers and Ronda Newell-Somers, marking a return to their roots with limited productions of terroir-driven wines. It is known for an Old World style that emphasizes balance and elegance, sourcing fruit from esteemed, sustainably farmed vineyards for its Pinot Noir and a cult-favorite Sauvignon Blanc.

properties.name: J.K. Carriere
properties.address: 9995 NE Parrett Mountain Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: J.K. Carriere is a small winery known for its focus on age-worthy, acid-centric Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and rosé from its dry-farmed, USDA Certified Organic St. Dolores Estate vineyard. The winery produces approximately 4,000 cases annually and employs minimal intervention winemaking to create wines that express their specific site.

properties.name: J.L. Kiff Vineyard
properties.description: This intimate family operation produces about 1,000 cases annually from its 10-acre estate, where owners Joel and Laurie personally host visitors and share their vineyard story. The hands-on approach extends to the vineyard itself, with Joel having hand-planted all 10,000 vines on the property.

properties.name: Johan Vineyards
properties.address: 4285 N Pacific Hwy W, Rickreall, OR 97371
properties.description: Johan Vineyards is a Demeter-certified biodynamic estate featuring 87 acres of vineyards within a 175-acre property that includes over 30 acres of biodiversity preserves like oak savannah and riparian zones. Renowned for holistic farming with sheep and chickens integrated into vineyard management, it crafts terroir-driven Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and unique varieties like Grüner Veltliner and Blaufränkisch through minimal-intervention winemaking.

properties.name: Jory House / Legacy Hill Vineyard
properties.address: 5081 NE Breyman Orchards Rd, Dayton, OR 97114
properties.description: Jory House is a vineyard-view vacation rental nestled in the Dundee Hills, overlooking the Legacy Hill Vineyard which produces Triple S Pinot Noir. The property offers panoramic views and provides guests with a welcoming bottle from Domaine Serene and access to nearby acclaimed wineries.

properties.name: J Rallison Cellars
properties.description: J Rallison Cellars is a boutique winery producing limited quantities of single-vineyard red and white wines sourced from quality vineyards across the Pacific Northwest. Their tasting room in historic Old Town Sherwood offers a casual setting to experience these small-lot, family-run wines.

properties.name: J. Scott Cellars
properties.description: This family-owned boutique winery crafts over 25 distinctive Pacific Northwest varietals, including uncommon Oregon offerings like Albariño, Petite Sirah, and Tempranillo alongside Pinot Noir, with twelve wines scoring 90+ points from Wine Enthusiast. Founded by UC Davis-trained winemaker Jonathan Oberlander, it operates an urban tasting room in Eugene’s 5th Street Market featuring artisan charcuterie and desserts, while developing its estate vineyards.

properties.name: J. Wright, Vintner
properties.address: 4225 N Pacific Hwy W, Rickreall, OR 97371
properties.description: J. Wright, Vintner is a boutique winery crafting small-lot, terroir-driven Pinot Noir and Chardonnay that express distinct vineyard characteristics, alongside its acclaimed White Pinot Noir. This LIVE Certified Sustainable producer emphasizes adventurous branding and partners with Left Coast Estate for production, blending artisanal winemaking with outdoor-inspired marketing.

properties.name: J Wrigley Vineyards
