properties.description: J Wrigley Vineyards is a family-owned estate known for its scenic vineyard views and handcrafted, estate-grown wines. Their acclaimed Pinot Noirs and Chardonnay reflect minimal intervention winemaking, offering elevated tastings in an intimate setting.

properties.name: Keeler Estate Vineyard
properties.description: Nestled amidst sweeping hillside vistas, Keeler Estate Vineyard is a family-owned, Demeter-certified biodynamic estate renowned for its natural winemaking philosophy. They craft unique Pinot Noir and Chardonnay using native yeasts and concrete eggs, yielding wines of pure expression from their exceptional property.

properties.name: Ken Wright Cellars
properties.description: Ken Wright Cellars is a winery dedicated to producing single-vineyard Pinot Noir that expresses the distinct character of its vineyard sources, with a portfolio featuring 13 different site-specific bottlings. Founded in 1994, the winery is also known for its foundational role in defining the region's sub-appellations and its deep involvement in local community initiatives.

properties.name: King Estate Winery
properties.description: Founded in 1991, this family-owned estate is the largest Biodynamic® certified vineyard in North America (1,033 acres), renowned for pioneering Oregon’s premium Pinot Gris and Pinot Noir. Its grand chateau-style winery offers panoramic views of the Willamette Valley and features an on-site restaurant highlighting estate-grown organic cuisine. Certified sustainable (LIVE, Salmon-Safe), the winery produces 240,000 cases annually across multiple tiers, including acclaimed single-vineyard bottlings.

properties.name: King’s North Winery
properties.description: A boutique label created by two brothers dedicated to capturing the vineyard-voice in each bottle, sourcing fruit from Oregon’s varied regions and emphasizing minimal intervention in the cellar. Their small-batch Pinot Noir, Rosé and Riesling editions showcase distinct vineyard plots and aim to reflect the grape’s true character rather than winemaker flair.

properties.name: King's Raven Winery
properties.address: 11603 S New Era Rd, Oregon City, OR 97045
properties.description: Family-operated since 1942, this scenic estate vineyard crafts distinctive wines using natural methods like indigenous yeast fermentations and foot-stomping, with all grapes dry-farmed across 35 acres of volcanic and sedimentary soils. Known for rare hybrid varietals like Maréchal Foch, Phoenix, and Léon Millot alongside Pinot Noir, it offers intimate tastings, vineyard events, and panoramic views from its Oregon City foothills location.

properties.name: K & M Wines
properties.description: K & M Wines is a small-production winery known for its food-friendly wines, crafting Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its own vineyard alongside bigger reds like Syrah. The tasting room in Carlton offers a speakeasy-vibe lounge and typically features flights of five to six wines, often accompanied by light food pairings.

properties.name: Knudsen Vineyards
properties.address: 9419 NE Worden Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: Knudsen Vineyards is one of the region's original and family-owned vineyards, established in 1971 and known for its estate Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from certified sustainable vineyards. The winery offers a range of tasting experiences at its scenic Dundee Hills property, from casual flights to guided vineyard hikes and curated food pairings.

properties.name: Kolb Vineyards
properties.description: Kolb Vineyards is an estate in the Dundee Hills defined by its mature, dry-farmed Pinot Noir vines from the Pommard clone, planted in distinctive Jory soil. While the primary focus is growing fruit, the hands-on, family-owned vineyard also produces small lots of wine for friends and family.

properties.name: Kuenzi Family Vineyard
properties.address: 7919 Spring Valley Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: This family-operated hillside estate in the Eola-Amity Hills specializes in Pinot Noir from volcanic Jory and sedimentary Dupee soils, leveraging its southeastern exposure and cooling Van Duzer winds for premium viticulture. Their scenic tasting room, opened recently with weekend hours, features valley views and offers Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, and food boards, bringing a relaxed, family-friendly atmosphere.

properties.name: La Belle Promenade Vineyard
properties.description: Operated by Flâneur Wines, this 40-acre vineyard planted in 2014 sits at 820 feet elevation producing organic, dry-farmed Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and other varieties from volcanic soils. The restored 100-year-old barn tasting room offers sweeping views of the vineyard and coastal range.

properties.name: Lachini Vineyards - The Villa Tasting House
properties.description: This family-owned estate's recently constructed Villa tasting house sits on their 45-acre biodynamically farmed vineyard in the Chehalem Mountains. Known for structured, age-worthy Pinot Noirs crafted with minimal intervention and inspired by Grand Cru Burgundy, the Villa offers panoramic views and dining experiences.

properties.name: La Chouette Vineyard
properties.address: 179-A Ankeny Hill Rd SE A, Jefferson, OR 97352
properties.description: La Chouette Vineyard, a small 15-acre estate south of Salem in Oregon's Willamette Valley, crafts acclaimed Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris exclusively from its hillside vines, earning accolades like 95 points for its 2018 Estate Pinot Noir. Known for its panoramic Coastal Range views and Tuscan-like ambiance, it offers intimate patio tastings by appointment amid oak-studded slopes overlooking the Ankeny Wildlife Refuge.

properties.name: Lady Hill Winery
properties.address: 8400 Champoeg Rd NE, St Paul, OR 97137
properties.description: Family-owned for five generations, Lady Hill Winery crafts acclaimed Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris from premier Northwest vineyards. Situated on a historic farmstead near Champoeg, it offers sustainable wines and a welcoming tasting experience with scenic views, picnic areas, and vineyard tours.

properties.name: La Luce Vineyard
properties.description: La Luce Vineyard is a small, one-acre estate in the Chehalem Mountains, farmed by the renowned Ponzi Vineyards and nominated by the American Grand Cru Society. This vineyard produces Pinot Noir with exceptional character from its Laurelwood soil, resulting in limited single-vineyard designated bottlings.

properties.name: Lange Estate
properties.address: 18380 NE Buena Vista Dr, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: Lange Estate Winery & Vineyards is a family-owned estate known for its Dundee Hills vineyards and world-class Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Pinot Gris. Founded in 1987, the winery farms over 60 acres of LIVE and Salmon Safe-certified vineyards, producing balanced, terroir-driven wines.

properties.name: L'Angolo Estate
properties.description: L'Angolo Estate is a family-owned winery known for its limited-production, estate-grown Pinot Noir and Chardonnay made with biodynamic farming methods. The winery features a beautiful tasting room known for its modern mass timber architecture that creates a seamless indoor-outdoor experience.

properties.name: La Randonnée Wines
properties.description: La Randonnée Wines operates as an urban winery from its Hillsboro location, crafting its wines from fruit sourced from sustainably farmed, third-party certified vineyards in the Yamhill-Carlton AVA. The winery is particularly known for its Pinot Noir from the Carlton Hill Vineyard and a Sauvignon Blanc that leans toward a tropical, French-inspired style.

properties.name: Late Sky Winery
properties.description: Late Sky Winery is a small, family-owned estate vineyard dedicated to organic farming practices for its Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. The focus is on a direct and personal tasting experience held at the vineyard, offering a clear connection to the land and its cool-climate varietals.

properties.name: LaVelle Vineyards
properties.description: LaVelle Vineyards is the oldest bonded winery in the southern Willamette Valley, established in 1994 on a scenic hillside near Eugene. This family-owned boutique winery is celebrated for its award-winning estate-grown Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Gamay Noir, alongside a dog-friendly tasting experience featuring Japanese-inspired gardens, fire pits, and panoramic vineyard views.

properties.name: Lavinea Wines
properties.description: Lavinea Wines is a producer of single-vineyard Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, founded on a minimalist winemaking approach that emphasizes site-specific character and transparency. Their wines, which have received multiple critical accolades, are sourced from mature, sustainably-farmed vineyards, with a tasting room located in Carlton

properties.name: Leaf and Vine Wine Lounge
properties.description: Nestled alongside tranquil Silver Creek in downtown Silverton, this cozy wine bar offers a laid-back retreat with curated local and international wines. Known for its relaxed ambiance and knowledgeable staff, it’s a haven for leisurely tastings and discovering new favorites in an intimate, creek-side setting.

properties.name: Left Coast Estate
properties.address: 4225 N Pacific Hwy W, Rickreall, OR 97371
properties.description: Left Coast Estate is a large, family-owned winery operating a 500-acre LIVE Certified Sustainable estate with 137+ acres of vineyards, renowned for its award-winning Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Pinot Gris alongside unique white Pinot Noir. The property features scenic hiking trails through preserved ancient oak savannas, solar-powered operations, and a popular tasting room serving wood-fired pizzas.

properties.name: Lewman Vineyard
properties.address: 6080 Bethel Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: A volcanic-soil estate planted in 1992 and acquired by Bethel Heights in 2020, renowned for its high-density, dry-farmed Pinot Noir, featuring five times more vines per acre than typical vineyards—which yields intensely mineral, age-worthy wines celebrated for their savory complexity and structure. Certified organic and part of Bethel Heights' acclaimed trio of vineyards, it crafts terroir-driven Pinot Noirs distinguished by notes of black raspberry, porcini, and mossy earth, earning consistent critical acclaim (e.g., 97pts from Jeb Dunnuck).

properties.name: Lia's Vineyard
properties.description: Lia's Vineyard is a winery sourcing from its organically farmed, dry-farmed vineyard in the Chehalem Mountains. The site is known for its mature plantings of Pinot Noir clones on Jory soil, which supply several esteemed artisan producers, and for its vegan-friendly winemaking practices. The vineyard was recently acquired by Cooper Mountain Vineyards.

properties.name: Lichtenwalter Vineyard
properties.description: This family-owned, LIVE-certified producer creates small-lot award-winning Pinot Noir using organic farming and a minimalist winemaking philosophy centered on terroir expression. Visitors experience the vineyard by appointment only for intimate tastings with the owners.

properties.name: Lingua Franca Winery
properties.description: Co-founded by Master Sommelier Larry Stone and Burgundian legend Dominique Lafon, this elite estate crafts biodynamic, terroir-driven Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its acclaimed Eola-Amity Hills vineyard, renowned for volcanic soils and cooling Van Duzer winds that yield wines of tension and complexity. Celebrated as a Wine & Spirits Top 100 Winery, it offers intimate, reservation-only tastings at its state-of-the-art facility with panoramic views, emphasizing minimalist winemaking and LIVE-certified sustainability.

properties.name: Lolati Wines
properties.description: Lolati Wines is a small, women-owned winery known for its bold red wines like Primitivo and Syrah, which are distinct from the region's typical offerings and draw inspiration from South African winemaking. Founded by winemaker and harpist Leigh Brown, the winery features a cozy tasting room in Sherwood and its labels are brightly colored, inspired by African fabrics.

properties.name: Lonesome Rock Estate Wines
properties.address: 18495 NW Meadow Lake Rd, Carlton, OR 97111
properties.description: Lonesome Rock Estate Wines is a small, limited-production winery known for its organically farmed, LIVE certified sustainable vineyard in a remote hillside setting. The estate focuses on Pinot Noir and Chardonnay that express the character of its high-elevation, volcanic soils and is not currently open for public visitation.

properties.name: Longplay Wine
properties.description: Longplay Wine: A boutique producer working with fruit from its own Lia’s Vineyard in the Chehalem Mountains AVA, this winery is known for crafting pinot noir and Chardonnay that reflect their site through minimal intervention and a solar-powered facility. The tasting room in Newberg offers an intimate setting to experience small-lot wines with a clear sense of place.

properties.name: LucidWild Estate
properties.address: 9380 NE Worden Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: LucidWild Estate is a family-owned winery known for its single-vineyard Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from 27-year-old, dry-farmed vines on its Dundee Hills estate. The winery holds LIVE and Salmon Safe certifications and offers a modern tasting experience with panoramic views of its vineyard and the surrounding hills.

properties.name: Lumos Wine Co.
properties.description: Lumos Wine Co. operates from a converted 1940s barn on its historic Philomath property, producing USDA-certified organic Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and Chardonnay. This family-owned winery is celebrated for its Wine & Spirits Top 100 Winery awards and offers scenic Mary’s Peak views, plus a rustic cabin for overnight stays.

properties.name: Lundeen Wines
properties.description: Lundeen Wines is an artisanal winery handcrafting unique expressions of both still and sparkling wines from its tasting room in McMinnville. Recognized as an original voice, the winery is particularly acclaimed for its transcendent sparkling wines, which explore the varied terroirs through thoughtful, innovative interpretations.

properties.name: Lurking Turkey Vineyards
properties.description: Lurking Turkey Vineyards is a sustainable, family-operated winery outside of Alpine, crafting high-quality wines that reflect the distinctive Willamette Valley terroir through meticulous viticulture and minimal-intervention winemaking. Known for its award-winning wines and picturesque tasting experiences, the vineyard engages deeply with the local community and agriculture, offering educational visits amid serene landscapes.

properties.name: Lynx Hill Vineyard
properties.description: This boutique, hilltop vineyard-only property features 9.2 acres of meticulously maintained Pinot Noir and Chardonnay vines planted in 2018, situated at 500–700 ft elevations ideal for premium grape cultivation. Surrounded by acclaimed neighboring vineyards, it is recognized for its established fruit contracts with local wineries and potential for expansion on its 27.3-acre estate.

properties.name: Lytle-Barnett | Aubaine
properties.description: ytle-Barnett | Aubaine encompasses two distinct wine projects. Lytle-Barnett specializes in traditional méthode champenoise sparkling wines, while Aubaine is a boutique producer of single-vineyard, estate-only Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its Anahata and Windfall vineyards in the Eola-Amity Hills.

properties.name: MADRONA HILL VINEYARD
properties.description: Madrona Hill Vineyard is a family-run, 19-acre estate in the Chehalem Mountains known for its bold and intense Pinot Noir from Laurelwood soil. The vineyard is LIVE certified and not open to the public, with its fruit sought after by several acclaimed wineries.

properties.name: Mad Violets Wine Co.
properties.description: Mad Violets Wine Co. is a boutique producer anchored by Buttonfield Estate Vineyard on Chehalem Mountain, farming and crafting small-lot Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Pinot Gris, and Riesling. Known for intimate, appointment-based tastings and a focus on site expression, it highlights estate fruit alongside select heritage vineyards.

properties.name: Maresh Vineyard and WInery
properties.address: 9507 NE Powell Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: Maresh Vineyard and Winery is a foundational family estate, first planted in 1970 and honored with the industry's Founders Award for its pioneering role. Now under third-generation winemaker Jim Maresh, the estate produces acclaimed Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its original, dry-farmed vines.

properties.name: Marshall Davis Wine
properties.description: Marshall Davis Wine is a family-owned winery known for its small-lot, vineyard-designate wines crafted by three brothers. The winery produces Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its Yamhill-Carlton estate vineyard, alongside full-bodied Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon sourced from the Walla Walla AVA.

properties.name: Martin Woods Winery
properties.address: 20500 SW Eagle Point Rd, McMinnville, OR 97128
properties.description: Deep in the oak-forested foothills of the McMinnville region, Martin Woods Winery is an artisan estate crafting graceful Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays that reflect their cool-climate terroir. Their meticulous, patient winemaking yields wines of notable balance and complexity, with limited tastings available by appointment at their secluded property or in downtown McMinnville.

properties.name: Maysara Winery
properties.address: 15765 SW Muddy Valley Rd, McMinnville, OR 97128
properties.description: Nestled in the foothills just outside of McMinnville, Maysara Winery is a family-owned, Demeter Certified Biodynamic® estate known for its pure, terroir-driven Pinot Noirs and Pinot Gris. This classic feel winery is celebrated for its holistic farming and minimalist winemaking that allows the unique vineyard expression to shine.

properties.name: McBeth Vineyards
properties.description: Founded in 2003 on a historic Eugene farm, this boutique, family-operated estate specializes in small-lot, 100% estate-grown Pinot Noir from Dijon and Pommard clones sourced from King Estate’s nursery. Situated at 800 feet elevation with marine sedimentary soils, it crafts approachable 'farm house' wines celebrated for vibrant mid-palate fruit and elegant structure, earning 90+ scores from JamesSuckling.com. The intimate tasting experience features panoramic views from a pergola-covered deck, available by appointment.

properties.name: McCleskey Cellars
properties.description: McCleskey Cellars is a boutique winery with an estate vineyard called Horseleap that produces about 25 tons of grapes annually. Their tasting room, the Horseleap Saloon, showcases Pinot Noir and other varietals crafted by local winemakers, offering quality wines at approachable prices.

properties.name: McKenzie Crest Wines
properties.description: This small-production winery crafts handcrafted, small-batch wines sourced from esteemed Pacific Northwest AVAs, specializing in diverse varietals like Barbera, Marechal Foch, and unique expressions such as its 'Sasquatch' line using spontaneous fermentation. Known for minimal-intervention winemaking that highlights vintage character, it offers monthly tasting events at its Thurston 'Wine Garage' and emphasizes balanced, terroir-driven styles across reds, rosés, and blends.

properties.name: Meraviglioso
properties.description: Meraviglioso is a family-owned boutique winery and vineyard known for its welcoming atmosphere and portfolio that includes Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and méthode champenoise sparkling wines. The winery provides a personal experience with small bites during tastings and regularly hosts live music and art classes on its patio.

properties.name: Mistletoe Vineyards
properties.description: This mid-sized, family-operated winery is known for its organic farming practices and diverse plantings, with 76% dedicated to Pinot Noir alongside Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc, and rare Tempranillo. It supplies fruit to prestigious producers like Ken Wright Cellars and Walter Scott, leveraging marine sedimentary soils in a scenic foothills location directly in the Mt Pisgah AVA.

properties.name: Monte Ferro Winery
properties.description: This micro-producer crafts fewer than 500 cases annually, sourcing fruit from select vineyards that practice salmon-safe and low-impact viticulture. Their vineyard-specific labels highlight award-winning cool-climate Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, with wines made by renowned winemaker Terry Brandborg of Brandborg Vineyard.

properties.name: Moore Family Vineyards
properties.address: 28041 Pleasant Valley Rd, Sweet Home, OR 97386
properties.description: Moore Family Vineyards, Sweet Home's sole winery, occupies a transformed historic radio station. Owners Ron and Angie Moore offer Willamette & Rogue Valley wines, hosting lively summer music events. This community-focused spot blends family heritage since 1926 with a welcoming tasting room atmosphere.

properties.name: Mystic Wine
properties.address: 11931 SE Hood View Rd, Amity, OR 97101
properties.description: Mystic Wines offers panoramic Cascade Mountain views from its Eola-Amity Hills estate, known for artisan 'Big Red' varietals like Syrah, Zinfandel, and Cabernet Sauvignon, bucking the region’s Pinot Noir trend with fruit sourced from The Dalles. This intimate, dog-friendly winery features outdoor seating, vineyard tours, and picnic amenities amid its sustainably farmed Dolcetto and Albariño blocks.

properties.name: Namaste Vineyards
properties.description: Namaste Vineyards crafts estate-grown wines from 40+ year-old vineyards in the Van Duzer Corridor, specializing in cool-climate Chardonnay, Riesling, and Pinot Noir alongside its signature semi-sweet white blend 'Peace'. Known for handcrafted wines and hilltop tasting rooms with panoramic views, it welcomes picnics and offers RV parking.

properties.name: Natalie's Estate Winery
properties.description: Natalie's Estate Winery is a family-run estate known for its diverse portfolio of small-lot wines, including bold reds like Zinfandel and Cabernet Franc alongside its estate Pinot Noir, all crafted with traditional European techniques. This boutique winery produces around 2,500 cases annually, with tastings personally hosted by the owners, reflecting its intimate and authentic character.

properties.name: Native Flora
properties.address: 11812 NE Worden Hill Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: Native Flora is a small, secluded estate vineyard and winery known for its owner-hosted tastings and all-estate production of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and méthode champenoise sparkling wines. The experience is intimate and private, set on a working farm with panoramic views, focusing on a personal connection with visitors.

properties.name: Nemarniki Vineyard & Winery
properties.description: Nemarniki Vineyard & Winery is a family-run estate honoring a multi-generational passion for winemaking, crafting its wines exclusively from sustainably farmed, LIVE certified grapes. The vineyard produces its own Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Dry Muscat, and also provides fruit for several other noted wineries.

properties.name: Nest Vineyard
properties.address: 2636 SW Schaeffer Rd, West Linn, OR 97068
properties.description: Family-owned estate operated by Keri Bailey, who transitioned from pediatric medicine to organic viticulture, sustainably farming 20+-year-old Pinot Noir vines across six distinct clones on volcanic slopes. Offers intimate, appointment-only tastings in a tranquil setting, featuring wines that express their unique hillside terroir and women-owned philosophy.

properties.name: Nicolas-Jay
properties.description: Nicolas-Jay is a winery founded on a Franco-American partnership, known for Pinot Noir that reflects a combination of Old World wisdom and New World fruit. Their wines are crafted from carefully sourced estate vineyards and are recognized for their precision and aging potential.

properties.name: Ninebark Vineyard
properties.description: First planted in 2014, this nearly 20-acre vineyard produces premium Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from volcanic soils without supplemental irrigation. The operation prioritizes sustainability through LIVE and Salmon Safe certifications while supplying high-quality fruit to regional wineries.

properties.name: Norris Winery
properties.address: 18285 NE Ribbon Ridge Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: This family-owned producer sources its site-specific Pinot Noir and Riesling entirely from the Norris McKinley Vineyard, planted in 2007 on a west-southwest facing slope. Winemaker Robert McKinley employs organic farming and low-intervention techniques to create small-lot, terroir-driven wines of exceptional restraint and elegance.

properties.name: North Valley Vineyards
properties.description: North Valley Vineyards crafts its Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and dry Rosé from grapes sourced through dedicated partnerships with growers across the northern Willamette Valley's sub-appellations. This approach is complemented by its own two estate vineyards, and the winery is known for a portfolio that includes regional blends and single-vineyard bottlings, all made with certified sustainable practices.

properties.name: Nysa Vineyard
properties.description: Nysa Vineyard is a family-owned estate in the Dundee Hills, known for its dry-farmed, organically grown Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its high-elevation vineyard. The winery is distinguished by its minimalist approach and for patiently cellaring its wines for years prior to release, ensuring they are gracefully aged upon offering.

properties.name: Oak Knoll Winery
properties.description: Oak Knoll Winery is one of Oregon's oldest wineries, recognized for its award-winning Pinot Noir and a diverse selection of wines that includes sweet wines and bold reds sourced from Eastern Washington. The winery offers a relaxed tasting experience on its property in the Hillsboro countryside, known for its pastoral views and vibrant event calendar.

properties.name: Ocelli Cellars
properties.description: This artisanal producer specializes in Grenache sourced from Washington vineyards, with a tasting room in downtown McMinnville. Known for their focus on this less common varietal, they create small-production wines that showcase the character of Washington-grown Grenache through minimal intervention techniques.

properties.name: Olea Vineyards
properties.address: 17406 SW Parrett Mountain Rd, Sherwood, OR 97140
properties.description: Olea Vineyards is a family-owned establishment on Parrett Mountain known for its welcoming atmosphere, complete with friendly farm animals and vineyard views. The winery's identity is deeply connected to an independent record label, with its handcrafted estate Pinot Noir named for musical artists.

properties.name: Olenik Vineyards
properties.description: Olenik Vineyards is a boutique, family-owned winery focused on producing small lots of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its estate vineyard in the Dundee Hills. With a production of just a few hundred cases, the winery is known for its limited-release wines that express the character of its vineyard.

properties.name: Oliver Springs Vineyard
properties.description: A family-owned micro-boutique estate planted beginning in 2010 that focuses on its own vineyards to produce limited-production Pinot Noir and Chardonnay (roughly 300-500 cases annually). The name honours the spring that feeds the creek by their vineyard, and the wines showcase thoughtful clone selections and dry-farmed vines in a low-intervention style.

properties.name: One Love Cellars
properties.address: 4736 Marion Hill Rd SE, Marion, OR 97392
properties.description: One Love Cellars is a family-run estate winery in Turner, Oregon, crafting cool-climate wines from its 60-acre property, including estate-grown Pinot Noir, Albariño, and méthode traditionnelle sparkling wines. Known for its scenic vineyard and forested setting with wildlife sightings, the winery really emphasizes sustainable farming and offers a relaxed tasting room with panoramic views of the Willamette Valley.

properties.name: Oswego Hills Vineyard
properties.description: This family-owned 40-acre estate features restored historic barns and produces a diverse selection of 20 wines ranging from whites and reds to sparkling and vintage dessert options. The property has become a popular wedding and event venue known for its picturesque grounds and rolling hillside setting close to Portland.

properties.name: Out of Necessity Wines & Vineyard
properties.address: 21080 NE Ribbon Ridge Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: This small family-operated estate in Ribbon Ridge farms organically and produces Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from their own vineyard. Known for their hands-on approach and intimate tasting experiences, the winery embodies a philosophy of doing what's necessary to create quality wines.

properties.name: Ovum Wines
properties.description: Founded in 2011 by husband-and-wife winemakers Ksenija Kostic House and John House, this minimal-intervention producer specializes in Riesling, Gewürztraminer, and Muscat sourced from diverse sites across the state. Their wines can be tasted at Bar Nina in Portland, and they're known for the acclaimed 'Big Salt' white blend that showcases their natural fermentation approach.

properties.name: Paradis Vineyards
properties.description: This small, family-owned winery operated by fourth-generation farmers offers a scenic tasting experience with sweeping vineyard views and a relaxed atmosphere, featuring estate-grown wines including Pinot Noir, Gamay Noir, and Early Muscat. Known for its welcoming, down-to-earth ethos and sustainable practices, it provides a rustic yet elegant setting ideal for picnics and private events amid picturesque surroundings.

properties.name: Parrett Mountain Cellars
properties.description: Parrett Mountain Cellars is a family-owned winery known for its focus on bold, limited-production red wines from varieties like Cabernet Franc, Zinfandel, and Italian grapes, alongside its Pinot Noir. The winery's lodge-style tasting room on the mountain provides views and hosts events.

properties.name: Pete's Mountain Vineyard and Winery
properties.address: 28101 SW Petes Mountain Rd, West Linn, OR 97068
properties.description: Family-owned boutique estate crafting distinctive Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and rare Cabernet/Syrah since 1999, with all wines named after family members and sustainably farmed across 16 acres of prime hillside vineyards. Renowned for its breathtaking Mount Hood views, converted alpaca-barn tasting room, lively Friday music events, and a unique 'non-wine club' offering exceptional discounts.

properties.name: Pfeiffer Winery & Tasting Room
properties.description: Pfeiffer Winery, established in 1983 on a former sheep farm in Junction City, is a pioneering southern Willamette Valley estate celebrated for its Obama-served 2006 Pinot Noir and 2023 Lifetime Achievement Award. Now operated by King Estate, its legacy includes a Tuscan cave tasting room, solar-powered vineyards, and global ambassadorship for Oregon wines through founders Robin and Danuta Pfeiffer’s travels.

properties.name: Pheasant Hill Vineyard
properties.address: 2250 NW Nut Tree Ln, McMinnville, OR 97128
properties.description: Pheasant Hill Vineyard is a boutique, family-owned estate specializing in limited-production Pinot Noir under its Pallino label, with fruit from its single acre of vines crafted by Apolloni Vineyards. This small winery offers private tastings by appointment where visitors can enjoy vineyard views and a game of bocce.

properties.name: Pheasant Run Winery & Tasting
properties.description: Housed in a historic 1905 bank building with original vaults repurposed as tasting spaces, this winery crafts estate-grown Willamette Valley Pinot Noir and aromatic whites alongside bold Walla Walla red blends like the signature 'Bank Robber Red'. Known for its unique setting, live music events, and charitable ethos, donating 10% of profits to local nonprofits, it blends rustic charm with community-focused hospitality.

properties.name: Pike Road Wines
properties.description: Pike Road Wines crafts its wines by sourcing fruit from over twenty small, family-owned vineyards across six northern Willamette Valley sub-AVAs, rather than from a single estate. This collaborative approach, guided by the experience of its sister winery Elk Cove Vineyards, yields wines of quality and value, which can be sampled in its welcoming downtown McMinnville tasting room.

properties.name: Pinot Vista Tasting Lounge
properties.description: Pinot Vista Tasting Lounge is an urban tasting room in downtown McMinnville offering wines from its estate vineyard in the Eola-Amity Hills, known for award-winning Pinot Noir. The lounge provides a comfortable, country-themed setting for sampling a variety of wines crafted with a commitment to sustainable practices.

properties.name: Poco Vineyards
properties.description: Perched at 700-725 feet in the Eola-Amity Hills, this boutique vineyard crafts expressive Pinot Noir from volcanic Jory and Nekia soils. Known for its meticulous farming, solar-powered sustainability, and Craig Hudson’s hands-on approach, it yields wines with vibrant fruit, bright acidity, and supple tannins in a scenic hilltop setting.

properties.name: Ponzi Vineyards
properties.address: 19500 SW Mountain Home Rd, Sherwood, OR 97140
properties.description: Ponzi Vineyards is a pioneering family estate founded in 1970, recognized for its world-class Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. It is known for a sustainable, gravity-flow winery, LIVE certification, and leading the establishment of the Laurelwood District AVA. The vineyards feature some of the oldest own-rooted vines in the region.

properties.name: Prince Hill Vineyards
properties.description: Prince Hill Vineyards is a historic site known for its Pinot Noir made from the famed Erath Clone 95, originally planted by Oregon wine pioneer Dick Erath. Now under the stewardship of Silver Oak's Twomey label, the winery continues its legacy from a hilltop tasting room with sweeping views of the Dundee Hills.

properties.name: Privé Vineyard
properties.description: A small estate founded around vines planted in 1980 on the Chehalem Mountains, this boutique producer focuses on old-vine Pommard clone Pinot Noir alongside select terroir-driven Chardonnay. With fewer than 1,000 cases annually, the winery focusses on expressive, site-specific wines sourced from its own estate and complementary sites.

properties.name: PROJECT M Wines
properties.description: PROJECT M Wines, founded by winemaker Jerry D. Murray, focuses on precise Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Riesling sourced from distinctive, sustainably-farmed vineyards across the valley's AVAs. The wines are made at the collaborative Carlton Winemakers Studio, reflecting a philosophy of capturing site-specific character.

properties.name: Proteus Wines
properties.description: Proteus Wines is a small, boutique estate on Chehalem Mountain, producing fewer than 500 cases of wine annually. This tiny, hands-on operation is known for its sustainably farmed Pinot Noir and an innovative dry white Pinot Noir, with its wines having received high ratings from Wine Enthusiast.

properties.name: Pudding River Wine Cellars
properties.description: This sustainably focused winery, established in a converted poultry farm along the Pudding River, crafts acclaimed cool-climate wines like Pinot Noir and stainless-steel Chardonnay, earning recognition from Wine Spectator and top competitions. Founded by engineer-turned-winemaker Sean Allen, the boutique operation offers custom crush services and a dog-friendly tasting room near Silver Falls State Park.

properties.name: Purple Cow Vineyards Winery
properties.address: 3336 SE Amity Dayton Hwy, Amity, OR 97101
properties.description: Purple Cow Vineyards is a whimsical and adventurous winery, drawing its name from Seth Godin's philosophy of remarkable business. They specialize in crafting unique wines from uncommon varietals like Marechal Foch and Tempranillo, offering a truly distinctive and educational tasting experience.

properties.name: Quailhurst Vineyard Estate
properties.address: 16031 SW Pleasant Hill Rd, Sherwood, OR 97140
properties.description: Quailhurst Vineyard Estate is a boutique single-estate vineyard known for its high-quality Pinot Noir. The winery provides a unique tasting experience with a world-class dressage horse facility and serene Japanese gardens on a historic property.

properties.name: Rain Dance Vineyards
properties.description: A family-owned estate cultivating vines across multiple sites in the Chehalem Mountains AVA since 2009, producing small-lot Pinot Noir along with Riesling, Gewürztraminer, Chardonnay and Gamay. With a renovated 1926 farmhouse tasting room amid gardens and even llamas on-site, the setting complements its sustainably-certified wines.

properties.name: RainSong Vineyard
properties.description: RainSong Vineyard is a family-owned estate nestled in Oregon's coastal foothills between Eugene and Corvallis, crafting wines since 1984. Renowned for its traditional-method sparkling wines, distinctive Pinot Meunier, and innovative Barrel Bottling Program, this small-scale winery operates sustainably with solar power and offers rustic weekend tastings amid scenic landscapes.

properties.name: Raptor Ridge Winery
properties.description: Raptor Ridge Winery, founded in 1995, is known for its single-vineyard Pinot Noir and estate-grown Grüner Veltliner from its LIVE-certified Tuscowallame estate vineyard. The winery crafts wines from a tapestry of sustainably-farmed vineyard sites and offers tastings with scenic views of the Cascade Range.

properties.name: Redgate/Elysium Botanicals Wines and Vineyard
properties.description: Redgate/Elysium Botanicals, located near Independence, crafts estate-grown Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris from its vineyard planted in 2006, earning medals for its wines. The winery features a rustic tasting room with panoramic farmland and coastal range views, hosting regular live music events and creative activities like paint parties on its scenic patio.

properties.name: Redhawk Vineyard
properties.address: 2995 Michigan City Ln NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: A boutique, family-owned winery known for its acclaimed Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Barbera, crafted by a winemaker with over 25 years of experience. Features a relaxed tasting room with panoramic valley views, dog-friendly ambiance, and picnic areas in a welcoming, intimate setting.

properties.name: Remy Wines
properties.description: Remy Wines is a distinctive winery celebrated for its Old World-style Italian varieties such as Nebbiolo and Sangiovese, and for its innovative, sustainable practices including a carbon-neutral winery facility. The welcoming farmhouse tasting room on the family vineyard offers a personal experience, reflecting the winery's progressive voice and deep community roots.

properties.name: Résolu Cellars Urban Winery Craft Wine Bar
properties.description: Résolu Cellars is an urban winery and craft wine bar producing small-lot wines from grapes sourced in the Chehalem Mountains and other Willamette Valley AVAs, as well as vineyards in Washington's Columbia Valley for bolder reds. This micro-boutique, family-owned winery is known for its wide spectrum of ultra-premium wines, including single varietals and unique blends crafted by a father-and-son winemaking team.

properties.name: Résonance | Carlton Tasting Room
properties.address: 12050 NW Meadow Lake Rd, Carlton, OR 97111
properties.description: Résonance's Carlton tasting room presents flights of organically farmed Pinot noir and Chardonnay from its estate vineyards. This project from the Burgundy house Maison Louis Jadot offers a signature tasting with jazz and vineyard views, featuring wines that have garnered critical acclaim for their elegant structure.

properties.name: Résonance Tasting Room
properties.address: 17205 NE Archery Summit Rd, Dayton, OR 97114
properties.description: Résonance offers tasting rooms in both Carlton and Dundee Hills, providing flights of its estate-grown Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from certified organic vineyards. The experiences include food pairings, with the Carlton location featuring sweeping vineyard views and the Dundee Hills salon offering a unique 'Route to Burgundy' tasting that highlights its French heritage.

properties.name: REX HILL
properties.description: A long-established estate with over four decades of winemaking, known for its refined pinot noir and sustainable credentials as a B Corp and Certified Sustainable producer. Its estate vineyards and modern tasting space reflect a blend of heritage and contemporary craft, offering a welcoming yet serious wine experience.

properties.name: Ribbon Ridge Vineyard
properties.address: 14775 NE North Valley Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: This small, family-run vineyard founded by Dewey and Robin Kelly offers a rustic, authentic experience that captures the genuine character of its wines. Most fruit goes to prominent Carlton wineries, with limited quantities reserved for their own label, available by appointment only.

properties.name: Ridgecrest (RR Wines)
properties.address: 20440 NE Ribbon Ridge Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: Ridgecrest cultivates the historic first vines planted on Ribbon Ridge in 1980, with 40-year-old estate vineyards surrounding their recently remodeled tasting cottage. They offer immersive experiences including vineyard tours and lunches among the vines.

properties.name: Rizzo Winery & Tasting Room
properties.address: 13005 Jerusalem Hill Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: This boutique, family-operated estate in the Eola-Amity Hills crafts diverse award-winning wines, including Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Viognier, and bold Columbia Valley reds, using Old World techniques like extended oak aging and dry farming. Renowned for its hilltop tasting room with panoramic views, opened in 2021, it offers a warm, intimate experience with wood-fired pizzas and innovative pours like winter Rosé and library vintages.

properties.name: ROCO Winery
properties.address: 13260 NE Red Hills Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: Founded in the 1980s by Rollin Soles and Corby Stonebraker-Soles, ROCO Winery is known for its small-lot Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and acclaimed méthode champenoise sparkling wines. This family-run operation focuses on sustainable practices, with its vineyards LIVE Certified and Salmon-Safe, and its 2013 RMS Brut was named Wine Enthusiast's #1 wine of 2024.

properties.name: Rodeo Hills Winery
properties.address: By Appointment, 10275 NE Worden Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: Rodeo Hills Winery is a small family collaboration known for its limited-production Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from its estate Pear Vineyard. The winery offers an appointment-only tasting experience in a distinctive tasting room with rammed-earth walls and sweeping views of the vineyard and hills.

properties.name: Roshni Vineyard
properties.address: 13101 NW Fox Ridge Rd, McMinnville, OR 97128
properties.description: Roshni Vineyard is a small, family-owned estate known for its sustainably farmed, older-vine Pinot Noirs and radiant Rosé, which are crafted from fruit grown on their LIVE-certified property. Their welcoming tasting experience includes panoramic valley views and reflects a heartfelt commitment to hospitality and their heritage, with a name meaning 'light'.

properties.name: R. Stuart & Co. Tasting Room
properties.description: R. Stuart & Co. Tasting Room is a cozy and convivial wine bar in downtown McMinnville, known as a favorite local spot for its friendly, approachable wines. The winery, founded by long-time veterans, is renowned for its nationally acclaimed blended Pinots as well as its limited-production Single Vineyard Pinot Noirs.

properties.name: Ruby Vineyard
properties.description: Ruby Vineyard is a small family-owned estate in the Chehalem Mountains, known for its Pinot Noir from some of the region's oldest vines, planted in 1973 on unique Laurelwood soil. This LIVE-certified winery produces naturally crafted wines that express the character of their dry-farmed, historic vineyard sites.

properties.name: Sarver Winery
properties.description: Founded in 2007 by Michigan transplants Chris and Erin Sarver (owners of Lake Superior Brewing Company), this boutique winery crafts 3,000–4,000 cases annually from its historic 35-acre Elhanan Vineyard (planted 1984). Known for cool-climate estate wines like Pinot Noir and Riesling, it offers panoramic views of the Three Sisters Mountains, wood-fired pizzas, live music, and charcuterie in its hilltop tasting room.

properties.name: Scenic Valley Farms
properties.description: This multi-generational family farm and winery operates sustainably across 1,000 acres, renowned for LIVE-certified dry farming, solar-powered facilities, and crafting wines from estate-grown grapes alongside diverse crops like hazelnuts and hops. Their welcoming tasting room offers rustic charm with fireplace seating, antique tractor displays, and picnic-friendly spaces, reflecting a commitment to approachable, high-value wines that balance terroir expression with accessible appeal.

properties.name: Scotch Church Road Vineyard
properties.address: 30125 NW Scotch Church Rd, Hillsboro, OR 97124
properties.description: This boutique vineyard crafts eleven wine varieties with a focus on estate-grown and vineyard-designate expressions, emphasizing a relaxed atmosphere. Known for hosting live music events and welcoming pets, they produce approachable Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays that showcase rustic fruit character.

properties.name: Sealionne
properties.address: 19500 NE Ribbon Ridge Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: Sealionne produces small-batch, dry-farmed wines with an experimental approach, pioneering 'chillable reds' designed to be served at cooler temperatures. The Ribbon Ridge property features a seasonal outdoor pavilion with a vintage Airstream, custom furnishings, and mountain views, creating an adventure-inspired tasting experience.

properties.name: Sequitur
properties.address: 14865 NE North Valley Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: Founded by Michael Etzel of Beaux Frères, this 12-acre biodynamic estate showcases 17 diverse clones of Pinot Noir and produces both traditional barrel-aged and unique amphora-aged wines. The Etzel Farm property, centered around a restored 1937 barn, provides an intimate tasting experience for these very limited-production wines.

properties.name: Seufert Winery Tasting Room
properties.description: Seufert Winery is a boutique producer focused on small-lot, single-vineyard Pinot Noirs that express the distinct terroir of their sourced vineyards. The tasting room, located in a relaxed urban warehouse setting in Dayton, offers exploratory flights of these site-specific wines.

properties.name: Seven Springs Vineyard
properties.address: 4180 Lone Star Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: This historic, biodynamically farmed 90-acre site in the Eola-Amity Hills, stewarded by Evening Land Vineyards since 2014, is celebrated for its volcanic soils, southeast-facing slopes, and cooling Van Duzer winds, yielding exceptional Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and rare Gamay Noir. Revered as an iconic source for acclaimed producers, its terroir-driven fruit underpins prestigious single-vineyard bottlings like Evening Land’s 'Summum' and 'La Source', which have garnered top scores (98 points) and international recognition for their mineral depth and complexity.

properties.name: Sherwood Hills Winery
properties.address: 17404 SW Parrett Mountain Rd, Sherwood, OR 97140
properties.description: Perched at 750 feet elevation on Parrett Mountain in the Chehalem Mountains, this estate produces Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Cabernet with a focus on meticulous farming practices. The winery has earned recognition including best of show at the Oregon Wine Experience, and offers tastings by appointment with sweeping valley views.

properties.name: Sidereus Vineyard & Winery
properties.description: Under winemaker Jason Bull, this family-owned boutique produces estate Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, Chardonnay, and Riesling through minimal-intervention winemaking that lets the hillside terroir shine. The winery complements its local portfolio with carefully selected Eastern Washington varietals, maintaining focus on elegant, balanced character.

properties.name: Siltstone Wines
properties.address: 12251 Southeast Dayton Bypass, OR-18, Dayton, OR 97114
properties.description: Siltstone Wines is a small, family-run winery producing about 1,000 cases of estate-grown wine from its sustainably farmed vineyards, including Blacktail and Owl Ranch. The welcoming tasting room is situated atop the Blacktail Vineyard, offering a relaxed, family-friendly atmosphere for sampling their Pinot noir, Pinot gris, and Sauvignon blanc.

properties.name: Silvan Ridge Winery
properties.description: Founded in 1979 as Eugene’s first bonded winery, this family-owned estate is celebrated for its three generations of female leadership and scenic hilltop location with vineyard views, cozy fireplace lounges, and a clock-towered tasting room evoking European charm. It produces 12,000–13,000 cases annually of diverse wines, including acclaimed Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and unique Rogue Valley red blends, under winemaker JP Valot.

properties.name: Silverback Estate Winery
properties.description: Silverback Estate Winery is a family-owned producer crafting acclaimed Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Gamay, and sparkling wines from its sustainably farmed vineyards. It features a striking modern-rustic tasting room with panoramic views of its 600-acre farm, offering an elevated wine experience amid the rolling hills.

properties.name: Six Peaks Winery
properties.address: 19495 SW Vista Hill Dr, Hillsboro, OR 97123
properties.description: Six Peaks Winery is a small, family-run estate with one of the area’s older vineyards, planted in 1981 on the Chehalem Mountains and known for views of six Cascade peaks. They craft estate Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, rosé and sparkling wines focused on finesse, purity, and graceful structure.

properties.name: Sokol Blosser Winery
properties.address: 5000 NE Sokol Blosser Ln, Dayton, OR 97114
properties.description: Sokol Blosser is a founding family-owned estate in the Dundee Hills, known for its world-class Pinot Noir and Chardonnay crafted from certified organic grapes with a deep commitment to sustainability. The winery offers a renowned tasting experience within its architecturally significant tasting room, which provides spectacular valley views and is complemented by an acclaimed farm-to-table culinary program.

properties.name: Soter Ribbon Ridge Vineyard
properties.address: 19486 NE Ribbon Ridge Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: Renowned winemaker Tony Soter's biodynamic operation includes a Ribbon Ridge estate that contributes to complex, age-worthy Pinot Noirs and sparkling wines. The Origin Series highlights single-appellation bottlings that express each AVA's distinct microclimate and terroir.

properties.name: Soter Vineyards Tasting Room
properties.address: 10880 NE Mineral Springs Rd, Carlton, OR 97111
properties.description: This appointment-only tasting room sits on Mineral Springs Ranch, a 240-acre Demeter-certified biodynamic farm producing ultra-premium Pinot Noir and sparkling wines from 30 acres of estate vineyards. Founded by renowned winemaker Tony Soter, the property features an acclaimed Provisions Tasting experience pairing wines with seasonal dishes prepared from ingredients grown on the farm.

properties.name: Springhill Cellars Winery
properties.description: Family-owned since 1988, this intimate winery crafts acclaimed Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and unique variations like oak-aged saignée rosé and Port-style Pinot from estate vineyards in the Willamette Valley and Eola-Amity Hills AVA. Perched on a 520-foot hill north of Albany, it offers scenic views of Mary’s Peak, picnic-friendly 'small plates', and a cozy tasting room with fire pits in a rustic setting.

properties.name: Stangeland Vineyards & Winery
properties.description: This family-owned estate, established in 1991 and rooted in a 1978-planted vineyard, crafts limited-production, award-winning Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Pinot Gris from its rocky, basalt-soiled slopes in the Eola-Amity Hills, emphasizing minimalist winemaking and sustainable dry farming. Renowned for its elegant, terroir-driven wines and scenic stone-walled tasting room with panoramic rural views, it remains a small-scale, under-the-radar gem celebrated for exceptional quality and international gold medals.

properties.name: St. Innocent Winery
properties.description: St. Innocent Winery, founded in 1988 by Mark Vlossak, crafts acclaimed, food-friendly Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and sparkling wines from prestigious Willamette Valley vineyards like Freedom Hill and Shea. This family-owned estate is celebrated for its scenic tasting room, sustainable partnerships, and wines reflecting Oregon’s distinct terroir, including Double Gold award winners.

properties.name: St Josef's Winery
properties.description: A pioneering, family-owned estate established in 1983, renowned for its food-friendly Pinot Noir, cool-climate Syrah, and award-winning sparkling 'Lilli' wines, all crafted from sustainably farmed estate vineyards. Known for its European hospitality, scenic pond amphitheater, and over 400 accolades, it blends rustic charm with intimate event spaces for weddings and tastings.

properties.name: Stoller Family Estate
properties.description: Stoller Family Estate is a pioneering 400-acre vineyard renowned as the largest contiguous property in the Dundee Hills, celebrated for its world-first LEED Gold certification and acclaimed, panoramic tasting experiences. The estate produces balanced and complex wines from its sustainably farmed slopes, offering a range of tastings from casual lawn gatherings to elevated gastronomic explorations.

properties.name: Stoller Wine Bar | Newberg
properties.description: Stoller Wine Bar | Newberg is a tasting room that offers a curated selection of award-winning wines from the Stoller family of brands, including those from their own estate vineyards. This urban wine bar provides a vibrant, community-focused atmosphere with live music and food from an adjacent kitchen truck, and was named Newberg's favorite tasting room in 2025.

properties.name: Stomp by Croft Vineyards
properties.description: Pioneering the first Sauvignon Blanc planting in the Willamette Valley back 1983 as a promise from a loved one, this family-operated winery farms organic-certified vineyards and operates a historic dance hall tasting room overlooking cherry orchards and the Willamette River. Known for award-winning Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Noir, it offers convivial indoor-outdoor seating with scratch-made pizzas and orchard-inspired small plates.

properties.name: Stone Griffon Vineyard
properties.description: Stone Griffon Vineyard is a small, family-run winery known for its distinctive, bold wines from its estate vineyard, including what may be the largest planting of Tempranillo in the region alongside Pinot Noir and Riesling. Their highly awarded Tempranillo and other wines are crafted in a hands-on style, with a relaxed, friendly tasting room located in downtown Carlton.

properties.name: Styring Vineyards & Winery
properties.address: 19960 NE Ribbon Ridge Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: This family-owned winery produces hand-crafted, award-winning wines with a focus on Pinot Noir and Riesling using sustainable practices. Operating since 2003 with a personal touch, Styring offers intimate tastings on their 40-acre vineyard with beautiful valley views.

properties.name: SummerField Vineyards
properties.description: This family-run boutique estate in Eugene crafts estate-grown Pinot Noir using organic methods, with wines like its 2016 Reserve offering notes of cherry and strawberry alongside a smooth, velvety finish. As part of the Willamette Valley’s acclaimed terroir, it focuses on expressive, food-friendly wines reflecting Oregon’s cool-climate character.

properties.name: Sweet Cheeks Winery
properties.description: Founded in 2005, this Southern Willamette Valley estate offers panoramic vineyard views from its Eugene hilltop location and is celebrated for its relaxed atmosphere, complimentary tastings, and community focus. It produces a diverse range of wines, including acclaimed estate-grown Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Pinot Gris, alongside unique warmer-climate varietals like Tempranillo. The women-led winery is also a popular wedding and event venue, recognized for sustainability efforts like Oregon’s first ReCORK recycling site.

properties.name: Temperance HIll Vineyard
properties.address: 6020 Bethel Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: Established in 1981 on an ancient volcanic terroir, Temperance Hill Vineyard spans 100 acres in the Eola-Amity Hills, featuring high-elevation slopes (660–860 ft) and Nekia-Jory soils ideal for cool-climate Pinot Noir. Renowned for pioneering organic and Salmon Safe certifications (awarded 2012), it supplies fruit to acclaimed producers like Antica Terra and Nicolas-Jay, earning 'Grower of the Year' in 2014 for its complex, site-expressive wines shaped by Van Duzer Corridor winds.

properties.name: Tendril Wine Cellars
properties.description: Tendril Wine Cellars is the personal wine project of acclaimed winemaker Tony Rynders. It focuses on small-lot Pinot Noir and is known for its innovative 'Five-Course' Pinot Noir tasting, a curated experience showcasing the range of the valley. The family-run winery produces limited quantities of wine with a vineyard-driven philosophy.

properties.name: Terra Vina Wines Tasting Room
properties.description: Terra Vina Wines is a family-owned winery known for its distinctive portfolio of big, bold reds, a signature style shaped by winemaker Karl Dinger's focus on purity of flavor and balance. The experience includes a downtown McMinnville tasting room and a seasonal estate vineyard tasting room on Parrett Mountain, which offers expansive patio views and food pairings from an onsite truck.

properties.name: Terra Vina Wines Vineyard
properties.address: 33750 SW Ladd Hill Rd, Wilsonville, OR 97070
properties.description: Terra Vina Wines is a family-owned vineyard on Parrett Mountain known for its focus on producing big, bold red wines, a distinctive choice in a region celebrated for Pinot Noir. The estate grows several varieties and sources additional grapes to create a diverse portfolio of full-bodied, complex wines.

properties.name: Territorial Vineyards & Wine Company
properties.description: This urban winery crafts estate-grown wines from its sustainably farmed Equinox and Bellpine vineyards, producing acclaimed Pinot Gris, Riesling, and innovative blends like The Mongrel, earning a 93-point score for its botrytized Late Harvest Chardonnay. Founded in 2001, its eclectic Eugene tasting room anchors Eugene’s Whiteaker neighborhood, offering live music, local ciders, and a vibrant atmosphere in a restored historic space.

properties.name: The Bramble, Silas Wines Tasting Room
properties.description: The Bramble is the tasting room for Silas Wines, located in a refurbished historic building in Amity. It offers the small-batch wines of Silas, which are handcrafted from grapes sourced from favored vineyards across the Willamette Valley, including the Eola-Amity Hills and Columbia Gorge AVAs.

properties.name: The Eyrie Vineyards
properties.description: The Eyrie Vineyards is an artisanal winery celebrated as the pioneer of Pinot noir and Pinot gris, with estate vineyards in the Dundee Hills. Its intimate tasting room in McMinnville offers flights of acclaimed wines, including library selections, from organically farmed, estate-grown fruit.

properties.name: The Four Graces Winery
properties.address: 9590 NE Worden Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: The Four Graces Winery is a family-founded estate known for its portfolio of Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and Pinot Blanc sourced from its own sustainably farmed vineyards. The winery's name honors the founders' four daughters, and its wines are crafted to express the distinct character of each estate vineyard site.

properties.name: The Fullerton Winery
properties.description: Family-owned and operated since 2012, Fullerton crafts elegant Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from sustainably farmed vineyards across Willamette Valley’s AVAs. Known for its 'Five FACES' and 'Three Otters' wines, the Corvallis tasting room offers an authentic, barrel-sample experience amid production facilities, emphasizing terroir diversity and Scandinavian-inspired hospitality.

properties.name: The Grove Tasting Room
properties.description: The Grove Tasting Room offers a curated experience featuring the wines of Montinore Estate and Landlines Estates, two wineries dedicated to Biodynamic and organic farming. Housed in a building with exposed brick walls, the urban tasting room provides a polished yet comfortable atmosphere for enjoying cool-climate varieties and Northern Italian reds.

properties.name: The Potter's Vineyard & Clay Art Gallery
properties.description: The Potter's Vineyard & Clay Art Gallery is a small, family-owned winery and art gallery known for its estate Pinot Noir and the unique fusion of handcrafted wine with pottery. This LIVE and Salmon Safe certified farm produces under 1,000 cases annually and was named a 'Winery to Watch' for its award-winning wines.

properties.name: The South Face Winery
properties.address: 16295 NE North Valley Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: This ultra-premium micro-boutique produces estate-grown Pinot Noir from a sun-soaked, south-facing hillside that inspired its name. The appointment-only tasting room offers hilltop panoramic views and limited-production wines defined by intensity and terroir-driven character.

properties.name: Third Block Wines
properties.description: Third Block Wines, founded in 2016 just north of Jefferson, crafts small-batch Pinot Noir, Gewurztraminer, and acclaimed Pinot Gris from premium Willamette Valley grapes. Known for its direct-to-consumer model offering exceptional value, this community-focused winery supports local causes and provides private-label services while earning accolades for its approachable, high-quality wines.

properties.name: Three Feathers Estate Vineyard
properties.address: 19569 SW Finnigan Hill Rd, Hillsboro, OR 97123
properties.description: Three Feathers Estate Vineyard is a boutique, women-led estate spanning high-elevation hillsides, where Laurelwood soils and a cool microclimate shape small-lot Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris and sparkling wines. Its intimate tastings, family farming legacy and quiet outlook over pond and vineyards lend a calm, pastoral charm.

properties.name: Toil Oregon Vineyard
properties.description: Toil Oregon is a small-production winery from the Figgins family, drawing from their estate vineyard in the Chehalem Mountains. It focuses on Burgundian varieties, producing Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and a highly regarded Rosé of Pinot Noir that showcases a crisp, vibrant style.

properties.name: Torii Mor Winery
properties.description: Torii Mor Winery is known for its Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from the Olson Estate Vineyard, which was originally planted in 1972 and is one of the region's older sites, farmed without harsh chemicals. The winery's gravity-flow facility and Japanese gardens provide a serene setting for tasting experiences that highlight their terroir-driven wines.

properties.name: Tres Colline Vineyards
properties.description: Tres Colline Vineyards is a boutique winery founded by three friends, crafting wines that express the character of its estate-grown fruit. The winery produces both the elegant Estate Series and the vibrant, next-generation Cuatro Series under the guidance of a seasoned winemaker.

properties.name: Tresori Vineyards
properties.description: Tresori is a family-run, estate vineyard planted in 1997 across 110 south-facing acres on steep hillside slopes, producing small-lot Pinot Noir. A reclaimed-wood barn tasting room offers views; wines include estate bottlings plus limited Viognier sourced from Folin Cellars, with competition medals and appointment-based hospitality.

properties.name: Tressler Vineyard and Tasting Room
properties.description: Planted in 2007 on Parrett Mountain in the Laurelwood District, this family-owned estate features five Burgundian clones of Pinot Noir alongside Tempranillo and Syrah. The tasting room offers sweeping valley views and showcases fruit-forward wines crafted by UC Davis-trained winemaker Gregg Colwell.

properties.name: Trinity Vineyards
properties.description: Trinity Vineyards is a small, family-owned boutique winery in the Salem Hills, celebrated for its panoramic Cascade Mountain views and sustainably farmed Pinot Noir, alongside Italian varietals like Barbera and Sangiovese. Founded by Steve and Cindy, it offers intimate tastings in a hilltop setting and hosts lively seasonal events, including live music gatherings.

properties.name: Trisaetum Winery
properties.address: 18401 NE Ribbon Ridge Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: This family-owned producer is renowned for award-winning Rieslings and Pinot Noirs from multiple estate vineyards. The tasting room doubles as a 1,500-square-foot art gallery showcasing owner-winemaker James Frey's paintings, blending wine and art into a distinctive experience.

properties.name: Troon Vineyard
properties.description: Nestled on the Kubli Bench, Troon Vineyard is a pioneer in biodynamic and regenerative organic farming, holding esteemed Demeter and Regenerative Organic Gold certifications. The estate is renowned for crafting distinctive, minimal-intervention wines from Rhône and Southern French varieties, expressing a profound sense of place from their revitalized soils.

properties.name: Trout Lily Ranch
properties.description: Trout Lily Ranch is a small, family-run estate on historic Adams Vineyard, planted in 1976 on the south side of Chehalem Mountain and farmed sustainably. Known for estate Pinot Noir from old vines, it offers farmhouse tastings by appointment with charming vineyard views.

properties.name: Tumwater Vineyard
properties.address: 375 SW Barrel House Wy, West Linn, OR 97068
properties.description: Family-operated 23-acre estate crafting acclaimed Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris, renowned for its scenic Barrel House tasting room, a converted timberframe barn with Mt. Hood views, trout pond, and bocce courts. Offers lively events like Thursday dinners, family-friendly hospitality until 2:30 PM, and wheelchair-accessible outdoor seating amid vineyard panoramas.

properties.name: Twill Cellars
properties.address: 21775 SW Ribera Ln, West Linn, OR 97068
properties.description: Small, family-run estate crafting elegant Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Syrah from their own 2.7-acre vineyard and sustainably farmed partner sites across multiple AVAs, using organic practices and dry farming to highlight terroir-driven distinctions. Offers intimate weekend tastings in a scenic West Linn setting with vineyard views, picnic amenities, and winemaker Chris Dickson’s restrained, vintage-expressive styles.

properties.name: Tyee Wine Cellars
properties.description: Tyee Wine Cellars is a family-owned boutique winery situated on the historic Buchanan Family Century Farm south of Corvallis, established in 1985 and known for its sustainably farmed, estate-grown wines like Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris. The scenic 450-acre property offers a relaxed tasting room in a converted milking parlor, picnic areas, hazelnut orchards, and a nature trail, reflecting its commitment to land stewardship and Salmon-Safe certification.

properties.name: Utopia Vineyards
properties.address: 17445 NE Ribbon Ridge Rd, Newberg, OR 97132
properties.description: A dry-farmed, organic producer of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, Utopia offers owner-winemaker Dan's personal touch and genuinely unpretentious approach. The tasting room provides outdoor seating and bocce ball courts for a welcoming, laid-back experience.

properties.name: Valcan Cellars
properties.description: Valcan Cellars is a family-owned urban winery in Corvallis crafting handcrafted Oregon wines since its founding, specializing in unique Malbec expressions like White Malbec and Sparkling Malbec from select vineyards. Their walkable downtown location near hotels and restaurants offers accessible tastings, with owner/winemaker Juan Pablo Valot leveraging 20 years of Oregon and Argentine winemaking expertise.

properties.name: Van Duzer Vineyards
properties.description: Family-owned since 1998, this estate winery is the cornerstone of Oregon’s Van Duzer Corridor AVA, renowned for its direct exposure to cooling coastal winds that thicken grape skins, yielding structured Pinot Noir and other cool-climate varieties. Certified sustainable (LIVE, Salmon-Safe) and celebrated for panoramic views overlooking Baskett Slough Wildlife Refuge, it also earned awards for native butterfly habitat restoration.

properties.name: Varnum Vintners
properties.address: 9500 SE Eola Hills Rd, Amity, OR 97101
properties.description: This innovative, family-owned winery crafts small-lot Riesling, Pinot Noir, and diverse sparkling wines, known for crafting Oregon’s first non-alcoholic wines and packaging bubbly in recyclable beer bottles. This vineyard is renowned for experimental styles like 'Porch Party' sparkling red and a relaxed 'Made to Drink. Don’t Overthink' ethos. They offer intimate tastings on their scenic estate vineyard with views of Mt. Hood.

properties.name: Villa Catalana Cellars
properties.address: 11900 S Criteser Rd, Oregon City, OR 97045
properties.description: Small, family-run estate crafting under 500 cases annually of unique wines like Sweet Pinot Noir, Grenache Rosé, and gold medal-winning Cascade Berry liqueur within a Mediterranean-inspired garden oasis featuring a rare-plant conservatory and Romanesque architecture. Known for intimate reservation-only tastings amid enchanting ponds, bocce courts, and wedding-perfect scenery evoking the Spanish countryside.

properties.name: VinTyr
properties.address: 3336 SE Amity Dayton Hwy, Amity, OR 97101
properties.description: VinTyr Winery crafts elegant, small-lot Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, reflecting a passion for terroir-driven expression. This artisan producer focuses on hand-harvested fruit and minimalist winemaking to create wines of purity, finesse, and a distinct sense of place.

properties.name: Violet Vines Tasting Room
properties.address: 203 W Main St Suite C, Carlton, OR 97111
properties.description: Violet Vines offers a modern tasting room in Carlton with curated flights and food pairings, while its estate vineyard provides an elevated, appointment-only tasting experience. The winery is known for its Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, with an expanding focus on Rhône-style wines from its vineyards in the Willamette Valley and The Rocks District.

properties.name: Violet Vines Vineyard and Tasting Room
properties.description: Violet Vines is a welcoming, family-run winery passionate about crafting elegant Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from their McMinnville estate. They offer a modern tasting room in Carlton and a stunning hilltop vineyard experience, sharing their love for the land through beautifully balanced wines and genuine hospitality.

properties.name: Violin Wine
properties.description: Violin Wine crafts elegant Pinot Noir and Chardonnay from grapes sourced through dedicated partnerships with dry-farmed vineyards, primarily within the Eola-Amity Hills. This small-scale winery, founded by Will Hamilton, is recognized for a minimalist approach that yields wines of regional character, purity, and graceful balance.

properties.name: Vitae Springs Vineyard and Winery
properties.address: 3535 Vitae Springs Rd S, Salem, OR 97306
properties.description: Founded in 1978, this historic, family-owned boutique winery in Salem’s hills is celebrated for its certified organic vineyards and rare old-vine Austrian varieties like Grüner-Veltliner and Müller-Thurgau, among the oldest plantings in the US. Guests enjoy rustic barn tastings amid sustainably farmed landscapes, with wines reflecting the site’s unique terroir and minimal-intervention winemaking.

properties.name: Vitis Ridge
properties.description: This family-owned boutique winery produces around 3,000 cases annually and is celebrated for its diverse portfolio of 30 unique varietals, including distinctive Marechal Foch, Gewurztraminer, and award-winning dessert wines, all offered at accessible prices. Set on a 150-acre estate, it features a relaxed tasting room with live music events, vineyard walks, and a pet-friendly patio where guests are encouraged to bring picnics.

properties.name: Walnut Ridge Vineyard
properties.description: Walnut Ridge Vineyard is a family-owned, LIVE-certified sustainable estate in the Lower Long Tom sub-AVA, nestled in the Coast Range foothills between Eugene and Corvallis. Renowned for its unique New Orleans-inspired tasting room—modeled after a 1760s French Colonial building—the winery crafts diverse estate-grown wines like Pinot Noir, Gamay Noir, and Riesling amid panoramic vineyard views.

properties.name: Walter Scott Wines
properties.address: 6130 Bethel Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: A boutique, family-run winery co-founded in 2008 by Ken Pahlow and Erica Landon, celebrated for its exceptionally mineral-driven Chardonnay and elegant, site-expressive Pinot Noir sourced from prestigious volcanic-soil vineyards in the Eola-Amity Hills. Despite its small-scale production (around 6,000 cases annually) and minimalist winemaking approach, emphasizing low yields, early harvesting, and native fermentations, it garners acclaim for crafting some of America’s most refined and terroir-transparent wines.

properties.name: West Haven Vineyards
properties.description: Family-owned since 2020, this historic vineyard features some of the region’s oldest vines (planted in 1976) and produces acclaimed Pinot Noir, Gewurztraminer, and sparkling rosés. It is also celebrated for its scenic event hall and covered patio, hosting intimate weddings with vineyard views for up to 120 guests.

properties.name: West Hills Vineyards
properties.address: 4785 Salem Dallas Hwy NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: This family-owned vineyard operates from a restored 1886 farmhouse on the historic estate of Oregon's 18th governor, known for regenerative farming practices like BioChar soil restoration and a convivial tasting room with chef-prepared cuisine. The scenic property offers Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and Rosé alongside bocce ball, live music, and event spaces in a pastoral setting.

properties.name: Wetzel Estate
properties.description: Wetzel Estate is a family-owned winery established in 1990, crafting limited-production wines under its Wetzel Estate, Chateau Bianca, and Opulent brands. Known for varietals like Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, and unique offerings such as sparkling wines and Vin de Glace, it maintains LIVE Certified Sustainable practices and features a scenic tasting room with rotating monthly flights, event hosting, and a hillside vacation rental overlooking vineyards and the coastal range.

properties.name: Whiskey Hill Winery
properties.description: Family-run estate specializing in distinctive estate-grown Pinot Noir, Rosé, and unique White Pinot Noir, alongside rare varietals like Léon Millot and Maréchal Foch. Offers intimate tastings in a scenic vineyard setting with picnic amenities, winemaker interactions, and collaborative local partnerships.

properties.name: White Rose Estate Winery
properties.description: Sitting in the Dundee Hills, White Rose Estate is a small winery known for its artisanal Pinot Noir crafted through distinctive whole-cluster fermentation. This approach yields complex and elegant wines from its estate vineyard, which is among the region's oldest and most respected sites.

properties.name: White Walnut Estate
properties.description: White Walnut Estate is a family-owned vineyard that was personally cleared and planted by the owners on the site of a former walnut orchard, now holding both USDA Organic and Demeter Biodynamic certifications. The estate focuses on estate-grown Pinot Noir and Chardonnay that have garnered significant critical acclaim for their vibrancy and complexity.

properties.name: Willamette Valley Vineyards
properties.description: Willamette Valley Vineyards, founded in 1983 by Jim Bernau, is one of Oregon's largest and most acclaimed wineries, recognized for its award-winning Pinot Noir, sustainable practices, and panoramic estate views. This publicly traded winery (NASDAQ: WVVI) combines innovative viticultur, including LIVE, Salmon-Safe, and biodynamic certifications, with visitor experiences honored as Oregon's '#1 Best Winery to Visit'.

properties.name: William Marie Wines
properties.address: 24730 SW Tile Flat Rd, Hillsboro, OR 97123
properties.description: William Marie Wines is a small, urban winery crafting handcrafted small-batch wines from sustainably farmed vineyards. Founded by a certified sommelier and his wife, the winery is known for its Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, along with a diverse selection that includes Bordeaux and Rhône-style varietals.

properties.name: Winderlea Vineyard & Winery
properties.address: 8905 NE Worden Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: Winderlea Vineyard & Winery is a boutique producer of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, recognized for its certified Biodynamic farming practices and status as a B Corp. The estate vineyard in the Dundee Hills features 50-year-old vines and offers a modern tasting room with panoramic views and curated experiences like vineyard hikes and seasonal luncheons.

properties.name: Windfall Vineyard
properties.description: This 117-acre estate vineyard occupies a prime hillside location in the Eola-Amity Hills AVA, celebrated for its panoramic views overlooking the Van Duzer Corridor and distinctive volcanic soils. Acquired by the Lytle-Barnett | Aubaine wine project, it supplies fruit for their acclaimed sparkling and single-vineyard wines, emphasizing terroir-driven quality.

properties.name: Wine By Joe
properties.description: Wine By Joe produces approachable, affordable wines sourced from vineyard partners across Oregon's growing regions, including the Willamette and Rogue Valleys. This large-scale producer is known for consistent quality across its portfolio and was a pioneer in using screw-top closures for its wines.

properties.name: Wine Fauve
properties.address: 17751 SE Amity Vineyards Rd, Amity, OR 97101
properties.description: Wine Fauve is an artistic, family-run winery crafting an unconventional range of wines, including estate-grown Cabernet Sauvignon from some of the region's oldest vines and celebrated Port-style wines. Founded by veteran winemaker Mikey Jones, this small, legacy producer is renowned for its hands-off, patient approach and wonderfully affordable bottles.

properties.name: Winter's Hill Estate
properties.description: Winter's Hill Estate is a family-owned winery and vineyard nestled in the Dundee Hills, known for its Pinot Noir and Chardonnay grown on a gentle southern slope. The Gladhart family has managed the estate since 1990, with a deep commitment to sustainable farming evidenced by their LIVE and SalmonSafe certifications.

properties.name: Witness Tree Vineyard Ltd
properties.address: 7111 Spring Valley Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304
properties.description: A historic, 100-acre estate named after a 19th-century surveyor’s landmark oak tree, renowned for its 100% estate-bottled, sustainably farmed wines (LIVE certified) and exceptional Eola-Amity Hills terroir. Known for value-driven Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, plus rare Dolcetto and Viognier, it balances acclaimed single-block bottlings with approachable pricing.

properties.name: Woodhall III Vineyards
properties.description: Woodhall III Vineyard is a historic 26-acre research property in the Lower Long Tom AVA near Alpine, donated to Oregon State University in 1986 by founders Dr. Frank and Betty Baynes, who first planted vines here in 1976. Now a premier viticultural research site, it features a publicly accessible AgriMet weather station, hosts advanced 'vine to wine' studies on rootstocks and smoke impacts, and provides critical climatic data for southern Willamette Valley growers.

properties.name: Woodshed Wine Company
properties.address: 9820 NE Worden Hill Rd, Dundee, OR 97115
properties.description: Woodshed Wine Company is a family-owned winery crafting micro-lot Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and sparkling wines from its historic estate vineyard, which features old vines dating to 1978. Their wines are released exclusively through an allocation list, and the tasting room offers complimentary visits with views of the vineyard.

properties.name: Yamhill Valley Vineyards
properties.description: As one of the region's oldest estate wineries, Yamhill Valley Vineyards crafts expressive Pinot Noirs and crisp Rieslings from their historic property. Visitors enjoy relaxed tastings on a shaded deck overlooking the vineyards, a testament to their enduring family legacy.

properties.name: Youngberg Hill Inn & Winery
properties.address: 10660 SW Youngberg Hill Rd, McMinnville, OR 97128
properties.description: Youngberg Hill Inn & Winery is a serene hilltop bed and breakfast offering luxurious accommodations amidst its organic vineyards. This estate is known for its panoramic valley views, award-winning Pinot Noirs, and immersive wine country hospitality.

properties.name: Zenith Vineyard
properties.description: An 83-acre estate in the Eola-Amity Hills, established in the 1980s and revitalized by the Ramey family in 2002, known for sustainably farmed Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, and unique varietals like Tempranillo and Auxerrois. Renowned as a premier event venue, it features a chateau-like setting with panoramic vineyard views, hosting weddings and tastings that emphasize terroir-driven wines and scenic hospitality.

properties.name: Zerba Cellars
properties.description: The Purple Hands Urban Winery and Tasting Room in downtown Dundee offers a laid-back experience where you can sample wines in an active winery setting. The wines are crafted from grapes grown at their estate Haakon/Lenai Vineyard in the Dundee Hills and sourced from other acclaimed vineyards throughout the Willamette Valley's sub-appellations.
